item.title: Chinese economy grows 5.4% in the first quarter of 2025
item.description: The Chinese economy grew 5.4 percent in the first quarter of the year, according to official data spread yesterday, as manufacturers rushed orders before the customs rates in the United States. Growth is in line with the rhythm of expansion achieved by the world's second largest economy in the fourth quarter and exceeds the goal of “about 5 percent” to the year 2025 established by Beijing. The impulse comes at a time when US President Donald Trump intensified the Beijing Trade War, threatening a total dissociation between the world's two largest economies, at a time when China already faces a prolonged real estate crisis. The data released by the National Statistics Office (GNE) exceeded the consensual estimate of 5.2 percent of economists responded by the Bloomberg news agency. Industrial production expanded 7.7 percent in March, compared to the same period of the previous year, in faster growth since June 2021. Retail sales have increased by 5.9 percent, the best pace since December 2023. "The most pleasant surprise is retail sales, which shows that consumption subsidies are working," said Michelle Lam, economist at French Bank Society Generale SA to China, quoted by the agency. "Industrial production was a surprise, but understandable after the strong export data. But this is now part of the past," he told Bloomberg. Despite the positive data, the GNE recommended caution, stressing the need to give greater support to the economy. "We must be aware that the external environment is becoming more complex and severe. The impulse of internal demand for growth is insufficient and the basis for economic recovery and sustained growth is yet to consolidate," the office said in a statement. “We have to implement more pro-active and effective macroeconomic policies,” he said. Investment in fixed assets increased by 4.2 percent in the first three months of 2025, while the real estate investment registered a 9.9 percent contraction, extending the crisis that reached the sector in 2022. The urban unemployment rate was 5.2 percent in March, down 5.4 percent in the previous month. Bonança and Storm China may have difficulty reaching its official growth objective this year without further stimuli. In recent weeks, several international banks, including the UBS Group AG, Goldman Sachs Group Inc. and Citigroup Inc., have lowered their growth forecasts from China to about 4 percent or less, the result of the aggravating commercial tensions with Washington. Some economists expect China's Popular Bank to reduce interest rates or the amount of money banks should keep in reserve this month, while others provide for several Yuan billion in loans and additional tax expenses to fill the void left by falling exports. China has to rapidly increase domestic consumption and investment to counteract the impact of tariffs. The weakness of the labor market continues to prevent consumers from spending more, even before US fees reach export -related jobs. The impact of the trade war will probably speak out of economic activity from April, after an increase of 12.4 percent of exports in March, as companies rushed to complete orders. The possibility of an agreement between the US and China on commercial dispute seems reduced in the near future, as Beijing chose to retaliate the successive rounds of Tarump -imposed tariffs. item.title: AMCM | Foreign exchange reserves fall to 235.8 billion
item.description: At the end of March, MSAR currency reservations were heading at 235.8 billion patacas, which represented a 2.3 percent descent compared to February, according to the latest data from the Macao Monetary Authority (AMCM). In February, the reserves had reached the 241.5 billion patacas. At the end of March 2025, the Cambial Reserves of the MSAR would correspond to about 11 times the monetary circulation, or 90.6 percent of the M2 monetary aggregate in Patacas. Aggregate M2 corresponds to the values ​​of monetary circulation and deposits to the order added to saving deposits, pre-advice deposits, time deposits, other deposits and deposits certificates. At the end of March, Pataca's effective exchange rate, weighted by its trade quotas, was 105.2, representing a decrease of 1.55 points compared to the data recorded in the previous month and a growth of 1.08 relative points compared to March 2024, implying PATACA fell monthly compared to the mains of Macau's main business partners, but rose annually.

item.title: SCM Hostel | Multimedia art of five artists on display
item.description:
“Verses of Rain in Late Spring - New Media Art Exhibition” opened doors yesterday at the SCM hostel gallery. The show exhibits Cindy ng sio ieng multimedia artwork, Kit Ka Ieng Kit, Wang Tou Kun, Chon Iap Lam and Xiaoqiao Li
The Holy House of Mercy (SCM) has a new exhibition on display since yesterday. It is “Verses of Rain in Late Spring-New Media Art Exhibition” [Rain Verses In late Spring-New Media Art Exhibition] and presents works by five artists: Cindy Ng Sio Ieng, Kit Kit Kit Kit Kun, Chon Iap Lam and Xiaoqiao Li. According to a press release released by the organization, artists “use digital photography, interactive digital sound installations, computerized painting and invisible paint” to make a new interpretation of the “ecological wisdom contained in the 24 solar terms”, creating a new artistic vocabulary. In the same note it is described that the works exposed “simulate natural light and shadow effects through virtual lighting techniques, creating the aesthetics of spring beauty”. “Real -time sound data is also used to conduct facilities through which the public can experience the rhythm of coexistence” of all exposed elements. This “interdisciplinary creation breaks with the traditional narrative forms of art, exploring issues of technology and sustainable development,” says the organization, which also says to “provide the public with a cyclical philosophical experience” based on rain power and the idea that “rain nourishes all grains”. Thus, "contemplation of the relationship between technology and nature is encouraged while appreciating art." Various dimensions Patent until May 28, this show was organized by the CAC - Circle of Macao Culture Friends, with Cindy Ng Sio Ieng as curator. Cindy Ng Sio Ieng indicates that the exhibition refers to the final period of spring, "with the arrival of the" grain rain "station, when it reveals a poetry of its own season that" flows around the world. " In this show there are “virtual light and shadow that simulate the dance of nature”, while the use of sound data by artists in real time serves “to boost the rhythm of coexistence”. In the case of artist Wang Tou Kun, born in Macau, digital photography is the means used to express itself artistically. Graduated from the University of Massachusetts Dartmouth, with specialization in digital media and photography, the artist expresses his personal experiences, both at the time and in the environment, and explores “the relationship between reality and virtual through digital media processing, in a concept that describes as 'post-photography'”. In this show at the SCM Wang Tou Kun hostel presents “The Interconnected Nature Forest Shadow”, inspired by the very environment of the Patio do Albergue SCM, a space in the middle of the São Lazaro neighborhood, with old trees. Assim, apresentam-se imagens “em camadas fluidas de tecido transparente”, em que as árvores espelham “sombras dançantes” e em que “as fissuras das paredes de tijolo e os veios das folhas” se interligam. The artist also presents the series of images “9+2: Kunyu Wanguo Quantu”, focused on the 11 cities that make up the area of ​​the Great Bay. “Using website screen catches, the artist extensively collects images related to these cities,” then resorting to “digital collage techniques, skillfully fusing the screen captures to build a surreal landscape of interconnected cities,” the organization describes. Chon Iap Lam, another participating artist, is a designer of theater lights and presents the work “Two-Dimensional Tree”, where he uses light and shadow facilities “to deconstruct the relationship between ancient trees and their shadows, as well as the two-dimensional and three-dimensional characteristics of the shadows”. Thus, “in the dream space created by the installation of light, the audience can feel the shadows of the trees to swing, as if immersed in a transparent fabric forest, surrounded by several tree silhouettes,” describes the curator of the show. With this work, Chon Iap Lam shows "the professional experience in light design, reflecting his exploratory spirit in the field of digital art." In turn, Xiaoqiao Li, a professor at the Hong Kong Metropolitan University Department of Creative Arts, presents digital animation work entitled “Phantom Terin: Landscapes Reimagined Through Gaussian Point Clouds”, where he employs 3D technology to create landscapes that explore the border between reality and virtual. Already the artist Kit Lei Ka Ieng presents “Unfold”, an interactive work that “uses coding to allow plant growth patterns to change in response to musical melodies, transiting perfectly between the forms of water droplets and crystals”. The artist has been dedicated to multimedia art, focusing on digital images, sound installations and new media.

item.title: Traffic | Less road accidents in the first quarter
item.description:
In the first three months of 2025 there was a slight descent, 3.44 percent, of the number of road accidents, compared to 2024. Also noteworthy for the lack of respect for drivers with pedestrians on treadmills. Fines continue to increase, with particular incidence for parking lots
Macau registered, in annual terms, a drop in the number of road accidents in the first three months of 2025. This is what the data of the Public Security Police (CPSP) say, which show that in the first quarter there were 3,626 accidents, less 3.44 percent compared to the months from January to March 2024. Regarding fines for violation of traffic rules, CPSP instituted a total of 193,000 in the first quarter, which constitutes an increase of 12.8 percent compared to the same period last year. The fines involved an amount of 51.67 million patacas, plus 8.32 percent. Regarding parking in forbidden zones, there was also an annual increase, with 171,000 fines, 14.5 percent, while in illegal parking lots, the increase was 10.92 percent, and 154.517 thousand infringements were verified in the first three months. As for illegalities committed in charged parking zones, or places with a parking meter, the increase is higher, around 62 percent, with about 17,000 cases in the first quarter of this year. Another fact that stands out is the illegal driving infringements of motorcycles, that is, without proper driving license, with 68.18 percent of cases in annual terms. In the first quarter of this year 37 infractions of this kind were registered. Of the numbers released by CPSP also highlights the large increase in cases of drivers who did not respect the passage of pedestrians on the treadmills, in a total of 173 processes, plus 47 percent. But on the opposite side of the coin, the pedestrians also did not comply, with the authorities to record 2,400 cases. Still, the reduction was 20 percent compared to the first quarter of last year. LESS TAXIS CPSP data also show how taxi drivers perpetrated, with an annual increase of 2.2 percent, totaling 660 infractions in the first three months of the year. Regarding the infringement type, abusive charges of tariffs had an increase of another 116.67 percent compared to the first quarter of last year, while the refusal of transport arises in second place, with 53.57 percent of cases. However, the offense that dominates is the act of “not waiting in order of arrival customers in taxi squares”, with 436 occurrences in the first quarter of this year compared to 21 cases of 2024. This is an increase of 1976.19 percent. Regarding improper use of the taximeter, a break of 68.42 percent was registered, while “other irregularities” had an increase in the order of 220 percent, with a total of 660 occurrences in the first trimester compared to the 206 cases of the first quarter of 2024 Regarding the payment of fines, in 48 taxi drivers paid a total of 52,000 patacas, and only three taxi drivers saw their license canceled for excess infractions within a period of five years. The authorities also received, in the first quarter, 270 complaints filed by the public due to the bad service provided by taxi drivers, and 80 percent was related to attitude and behavior to customers.

item.title: Death | Elaine Wynn, co-founder of the Wynn Resorts group died
item.description:
Elaine Wynn died last Tuesday at the age of 82. The co-founder of the Wynn Resorts Hotels and Casinos Group leaves a brand as a businesswoman, philanthropist and “tireless defender of Las Vegas, children and their education,” says the company that helped found
Billionaire and philanthropic businesswoman Elaine Wynn, co-founder of the Wynn Resorts Hotels and Casinos Group, died at 82, the company said. “As a co-founder and one of Wynn Resorts' greatest shareholders, he helped create and turn the company into one of the most beloved luxury resort brands in the world,” says the statement, not detailing the circumstances of his death. "He was a tireless defender of Las Vegas, children and their education, and the arts," adds the obituary, who says that the businesswoman recently celebrated the 20th anniversary of the Wynn Hotel in Las Vegas, and also created the Hotel Encore. Elaine Wynn, who was born in New York in 1943, adopted her ex-husband Steve Wynn's surname, the heir of Bingo Leste bingo halls, with whom he has been divorced twice and who, over 44 years, has helped to shape Las Vegas. Wynn have created the luxury chains Wynn Resorts and Mirage Resorts, and are attributed to the revitalization of the hotel zone known as the strip, including the Bellagio Hotel, with its famous source, or the Mirage Hotel, with its astonishing volcano. In Macao, where the operator started activities after the game liberalization, Wynn holds several game projects and integrated resort, namely Wynn Macau and Wynn Palace at Cotai, through the company Wynn Macau Ltd. In February Wynn Resorts was again recognized as one of the “most admired companies in the world”, a distinction attributed by Fortune magazine. Wynn Resorts received the highest rating for a casino resort, obtaining “a good score in the product / service quality category”, describes an official Wynn note about the distinction. Definitive divorce in 2010 The businesswoman definitely divorced Steve Wynn in 2010, but remained the largest individual shareholder of Wynn Resorts and also dedicated herself to philanthropic work, especially in arts and education, recall local media. Las Vegas political figures mourned his death, including Mayor Shelley Berkley, who said Elaine had planned an art museum in the city, and Nevada governor Joe Lombardo considered her a "visionary business woman." Personally, Elaine had two daughters with Moganta Steve Wynn, with whom she had a divorce that intensified when she was accused of sexual harassment in 2018, a scandal that forced him to withdraw from his company and which he suggested had been "instigated" by his ex-wife. According to Wynn Resorts annual report of 2024, published on December 31, Elaine Wynn had about 8.85 percent of the ordinary actions in circulation, being the second largest shareholder of the company, behind American billionaire Tilman Fertitta. According to Forbes magazine, Elaine Wynn's liquid heritage, in relation to this year, was $ 1.9 billion.

item.title: Electronic Cigarettes | LAM LON WAI WANTS TOTAL PROHIBITION
item.description:
The deputy of the workers asked the government to have a deadline for the ban on electronic cigarettes, and argues that smoking is prohibited at the door of restaurants and residential buildings, busy streets and outdoor areas near schools and kindergartens.
Lam Lon Wai wants to know when the government will prepare a bill to fully prohibit the use of electronic cigarettes. The issue is part of the latest written interpellation of the deputy linked to the Federation of Macao Workers Associations (Faom). In the interpetement, the deputy indicates that "the latest inquiries" show that "Macao young people are increasingly using electronic cigarettes." In the optics of Lam Lon Wai, this type of cigarettes is dangerous because "it has been used for drug use in neighboring regions." Therefore, the deputy asks if the authorities will "do what they said before and propose new changes to the smoking control law." Lam Lon Wai also asks the government to refer to what situation are the work to prohibit electronic cigarettes and to present a calendar for the approval of the measure and its entry into force. Since 2022 a ban on entry or exit of the territory of electronic cigarettes is in force. Infringers risk paying a fine that can reach 4,000 patacas. However, if electronic cigarettes are in Macau can be used. And this is an aspect that Lam Lon Wai wants to see punished. More Tobacco Free Areas In order to control tobacco consumption, Lam Lon Wai also intends that the government advances with the creation of more cigarette -free areas near schools, hospitals and other public facilities. "Residents are not satisfied with tobacco policies and say it is difficult to avoid passive smoke. They also expect authorities to continue to pay more attention, widening the zones of smoking and reinforcing advertising and law enforcement," wrote the legislator. According to the deputy's proposal, health authorities should consider applying smoking prohibitions in places such as residential buildings, restaurants and busiest streets and even private cars, when they are children, as it says it is increasingly frequent in Hong Kong. In addition to prohibitions, Lam suggests greater effort to help people smoke, with the creation of clinics and increasing inspection and punishment. "Especially with regard to the healthy growth of young people, it takes more preventive education about tobacco and alcohol […] and increasing young people's awareness of self -protection and we will establish a solid foundation for the project of a healthy macao," he said.

item.title: Health | Government advances decision and promises to study early directive
item.description:
The government considers that legislation to allow someone to give up receiving medical treatment will "face various problems." Therefore, it promises to continue to study the subject, without committing to any decision
The government considers that doing a law that allows people to abdicate in advance of receiving medical treatments before they have lost their ability to communicate will "face various problems." This is how the Institute of Social Action (IAS), through President Hon Wai, responded to an interpellation of Ho Ion Sang on the subject. However, the president of IAS considers that the work done so far to elaborate the new legislation were "positive". The early directive, also known as an early decision or vital will, is a choice that can be taken by citizens to refuse some specific types of treatment in the future. A practical example of your application may be when a person is in brain death, but with vital functions only artificially ensured. The early directive may establish a person's will not be linked to the machines. The choice is allowed in regions and countries such as Portugal, Spain, Germany, South Korea, Israel, Singapore, the United States, Canada, among others. The question arises after Hong Kong legislated on the subject, and the Macao authorities put the possibility of advancing in this regard in 2021, including the creation of a study group. However, in view of HO issues, the government considers that there are still no conditions [to submit the proposal of law], although preliminary legislative comparison work was “positive”. What is that? In the understanding of the authorities it is necessary to explain to the population the reach of the early directive, which is often unknown: “Given that the legislation on the creation of the 'early direction of will' will face several problems, namely, in terms of social concept and at the level of execution, health services plan to reinforce education and dissemination, in order to raise citizens' knowledge of 'early direction of will',” was communicated. “Alongside this, they plan to carry out, in collaboration with academic institutions, a study on the 'early directive of will', promoting, in an orderly manner, the respective works,” he was added. It should be noted that the theme was addressed in the study “Advance Directives in Macao: Not Legally Recognissed, But.” [DAV in Macao: No legal recognition, but… ”, signed by Man Teng Iong, professor at the University of Macao Law School (one), and Vera Lúcia Raposo, former director of the same faculty and currently a teacher at the Faculty of Law of the New University of Lisbon. In the same vein, the government guarantees that it will work with local associations so that the issue is discussed with the aim of achieving consensus. In the document, authorities also argue that in recent years have reinforced efforts to ensure that palliative care at MSAR have increasingly responding to needs and better quality.

item.title: Beijing, Hong Kong and Macau accuse the US of attacking China's survival
item.description: The Chinese Communist Party's main official for Hong Kong and Macao affairs and governments of both regions yesterday accused the United States of imposing tariffs to sabotage China. "The US has targeted our tariffs, they target our own survival," said Xia Baolong, director of the Hong Kong and Macau affairs, under the tutelage of the State Council. "Although Hong Kong is the largest source of US commercial surplus, the United States still imposed high tariffs. This is extremely arrogant and blatant," said Xia. "The US cannot tolerate Hong Kong's prosperity and stability and are the biggest sinister manipulator that undermines human rights, freedom, the rule of law, prosperity and stability in Hong Kong," the leader added. Xia spoke in a pre-recorded speech, transmitted during the inauguration of an exhibition in Hong Kong, regarding the National Security Education Day. “Whoever tries to lead us back to poverty and weakness is our enemy,” warned the leader. "Those who betray national interests and cheer for the enemy at critical times will never be tolerated," he added. Chief Words Today, at the same ceremony, Hong Kong's government leader John Lee Ka-Chiu accused the United States of, in a "wicked logic," imposing tariffs to protect his "unhealthy hegemony." "The United States oppose free trade, interrupt global trade and supply chains (…), severely damaging the multilateral trade system and the process of globalization," said John Lee. The chief executive has assured that Hong Kong "will keep his status from Porto Franco with basically null fees" and will file a complaint against the United States to the World Trade Organization. Also the leader of the Macao government yesterday criticized the United States for the "abusive imposition of customs taxes on all its business partners," including China, "under several pretexts." Also during the inauguration of an exhibition due to National Security Education Day, Sam Hou Fai said Washington "severely devastated the multilateral trade system (...) and damaged the stability of the world economic order."

item.title: History | Book about Americans in Macao in the 19th century presented today
item.description:
The book “To the Farthest Gulf for the Wealth of India - Macao Representations in the Peabody Essex Museum (Salem)”, by Rogério Miguel Puga, tells the story of Americans who lived in Macao in the nineteenth century. The Academic today presents in the Portuguese Bookstore the work that resulted from consultation with records stored in a museum in Salem, in the state of Massachusetts
Macao has long been a place of trade and experiences of people from around the world. One of the foreign communities that lived in the territory, in the busy nineteenth century, consisted of Americans, whose presence in Macao lasted in photographs, diaries, objects and paintings, present at the Peabody Essex Museum, in Salem, Massachusetts. These signs of the ostentation of life, wealth and business that Americans had in the territory were the subject of analysis by Rogério Miguel Puga. The academic linked to New University of Lisbon launched, in 2023, a book that resulted from years of investigation into this theme, entitled “To the Farthest Gulf for the Wealth of India - Macao Representations at Peabody Essex Museum (Salem)”. The author presents today the work in Macau, from 18:30, in a session in the Portuguese Bookstore. At HM, it tells a little about the long course of research and writing, which was supported by the Macau Foundation. "I started the book in Macao in 2009, but only in 2023 was released. It makes perfect sense to present the book in the city that is the subject of the investigation and where it was started." The academic states that today's presentation in the Portuguese bookstore is “doubly symbolic” because there is a collaboration with Ciela, a research center of the University of Macau (one), where Rogério Miguel Puga has presented some lectures on the themes of the book, dynamized by professor Mário Pinharanda Nunes. Today's session at the Portuguese Bookstore is moderate by Joshua Erlich, a professor at UM, “who also conducts research on the East India Company in India, thus communicating his work with my study on the British presence in Macau between 1635 and 1793, already published,” said Rogério Miguel Puga. item.title: Japan | Regulator accuses Google of violating anti -monopoly laws
item.description: Japanese regulatory authorities accused US technology to violate anti-monopoly laws, referring to similar actions in the United States and Europe. Google Japan stated in a statement that it considered action “unfortunate” and the company said it has invested significantly in the country to promote innovation as a technological leader. The “order of cessation and withdrawal” of Japan's Fair Trade Commission says Google has to stop the Google search engine preinstallation on Android smartphones, which, according to the commission, actually excludes the competition. It is not known if Google, a subsidiary of Alphabet Inc., based in Silicone Valley, USA, will take legal action to combat the order. In the US, a judge decided last year that Google's “omnipresent” search engine illegally explored his dominance to master the competition. Google has denied the allegations, arguing that it is immensely popular because people like what it offers. Japanese regulators began research on Google in 2023 and say they have consulted foreign authorities who dealt with similar cases. European regulators also criticized what they consider to be Google's monopolistic domain. Tuesday's decision marks the first time that Japan's Fair Trade Commission takes action against a large world technological company.

item.title: AL | Sam Hou Fai launches support for birth, but warns for budget revenues
item.description:
In his first lines of government action, Sam Hou Fai announced the creation of a new “childhood subsidy” that will assign up to 18,000 patacas per year to permanent residents under three years. However, it warned of economic difficulties
In the first lines and government action he presented to the population of Macau, Sam Hou Fai announced the creation of a new childhood allowance that will assign a maximum and 18,000 patacas per year to children under three years. In the Legislative Assembly, the Chief Executive revealed the creation of a new social support and the updating of others, underlined that the government places the well-being of the population as the great priority. Although it has only mentioned the “mitigation of population concerns” such as the third priority of the government's policies, behind other aspects such as the diversification of the economy and the efficiency of governance in the MSAR, Sam ensured that the population is the first priority: “The well-being of the population is fundamental. This government will persist in placing the interests of the population first and, taking into account the subjects related to their daily life, to solve the real problems. More pressing, with a view to responding to their aspirations for a quality life, ”he promised. As part of this policy, Sam Hou Fai has announced the support changes that are mainly intended to promote the increase in the birth rate and to support the elderly population or with special needs. At birth, the big news was the creation of the “childhood assistance subsidy” that will assign to each permanent resident child up to three years old an amount of 1,500 patacas per month, which can reach a maximum of 18 thousand patacas per year. This incentive is added an increase of 1,082 patacas from the birth subsidy, which rises from current 5,418 patacas to 6,500 patacas. Also the marriage subsidy is increased by 78 patacas, 2,122 patacas to 2,220 patacas. For the elderly At the level of support for the elderly, the elderly subsidy is increased by 1,000 patacas, rising from the maximum annual amount of 9,000 to 10,000 patacas. At the same time, the pension for the elderly is updated from a monthly amount of 3,740 per month to 3,900 patacas per month, a difference of 160 patacas per month. As this pension is paid thirteen times throughout the year, the maximum amount rises 2,080 patacas, from current 48,620 patacas to 50,700 patacas. Regarding residents with disability, normal allowance will be increased to 10,000 patacas per year, compared to current 9,000 patacas. The special disability allowance has a larger increase from the current 18,000 patacas to 20,000 patacas, a difference of 2,000 patacas. Another of the news is an update of health valleys, which will rise to 700 patacas, when they are currently 600 patacas. Economics warnings At the economy level, although without ever mentioning the new trade war between the United States and China, the chief executive warned that the Economy of the MSAR will not pass unscathed, although it can count on the interior market. "We have witnessed, in recent years, the aggravation of unilateralism and protectionism, the insufficiency of dynamics prone to world economic growth, as well as the increase of unforeseen events and uncertainties," he said. "Deep and complex changes in the internal and external environment have already manifested and will persist, so Macau, as a microeconomic strongly turned outside, could not be immune to the resulting impacts," he added. "For all this, we should not underestimate any threats and challenges, before, we must always be aware of the risks and a sense of warning, so that we are prepared to act against all potential threats," he warned. Sam Hou Fai also acknowledged that the current revenues are below the expected and that there may be a need to have a reformulation of the mashed budget in force. In terms of economy support, the government leader has announced a bank credit bonus plan for small and medium enterprises, which will allow entrepreneurs to obtain up to 4 percent of loan interest rates for three years of a maximum of 5 million PATACA. The maximums of bonusted total loans cannot exceed 10 billion patacas. Checks with “Requirements” In yesterday's presentation, Sam Hou Fai said that the amounts paid in the pecuniary checks will remain, ensuring that the pecuniary reimbursement program should be changed, without being announced which. "After the hell of the opinions of all sectors of the company, the improvement of a monetary regime will be performed, using savings in expenses to increase the welfare of residents and promote the development of the community economy." In the same session it was mentioned that the money is attributed to residents “who meet the requirements”, so it remains to know what these requirements will be. Focus on terrorism In the lag presented yesterday by Sam Hou Fai National Security had a lower prominence in the face of the speeches of Ho IAT SENG. Still, it has been indicated that for this year the reformulation of the State Security Defense Commission will be studied and new laws will be thought of to combat terrorism. In the context of nationalism, framed in the chapter of national security, it was explained that the government will further support associations considered as patriotic, while events will be organized to celebrate the 80th anniversary of the War Victory against Japan. Cash reform At the public administration level, the Chief Executive announced that he will submit a proposal to reformulate the Institute for Municipal Affairs. The bill must enter the Legislative Assembly by the end of the year. The changes have not been detailed, but the great goal is to "simplify the organic structure of the government and raise the efficiency of its functioning." Also the Directorate of Administration and Public Services will be reformulated this year. In addition, Sam Hou Fai has promised that civil servants will begin to oath loyalty. item.description:
Dora Nunes Gago, writer and former director of the Portuguese Department of Portuguese, has just launched a new poetry book. "Flowers of Gray" ends the trilogy of works dedicated to Macau, composed of "flowered by mistake the angry roses" and "Nomadic Words"
It was ten years that translated into many words. So many, who gave three books, “they were mistakenly flowered to the angry roses”, clearly reference to Camilo Pessanha; “Nomadic Words” and now “Gray Flowers”. Dora Nunes Gago's new poetry book, a teacher and former director of the Portuguese Department of Macao (one), also refers to Macau who lasts in his memory and, therefore, translates into words. With the seal of Humus, the book has just left Portugal, resulting from the "many poems" written by Dora Nunes Gago during the period in Macao, an experience that turned her into an published and award -winning author. Writing poetry in these years of teaching and experience the East turned out to be the way found to deal with Macau's reviliations and their dynamics. “Perhaps because it is a shorter record, a way to capture moments, of crystallizing them, in the midst of all the bullshit and surprises that Macau dresses. Maria Ondina Braga referred to the work“ Statue de Sal ”, written in Macao, around 1963, that Macau is 'sleep of sleep and poetry'. Hm. “Gray Flowers” ​​is called because he went to seek inspiration from a poem by Natália Correia: “(…) young people oblivious to the pulcitude of the body in celebration / pass me as cypresses of cypresses / And the youth gray flower is an edge / strike me by opening vacuums of wild flowers (…) / the gallop in a teeth foam.” Dora Nunes Gago selected the “surviving poems” of the remaining two titles of the trilogy. “There were those who were lost, between changes, travel, blocks and lost notebooks.” Like the whole macao's own revocation. In "Gray Flowers," the territory "is represented by rituals, the symbolic times like the Chinese New Year, which is that festive time when the world is reborn and inventing itself." There are also elements that become poetry such as the dumplings, the temples, the island of Hengqin, where the author lived in the days she taught at one. “The territory is present in the images, but also in the solitude and silence that inhabits the poems, all of them very short. In this book, my obsession with synthesis culminated,” he describes. Each book, a message There are poems that speak for themselves, others who need to be explained. And speaking of the trilogy he has written in recent years, Dora Nunes Gago refers to the first, where the pessanha symbolism is sought and where he denotes "the first look at Asia and Macao." Here there is no poetry, but 24 tales, "many of them inspired by witnessed stories, heard or read in newspapers." Already the award -winning “Nomadic Words”, winner of the Grand Travel Literature Prize Maria Ondina Braga last year, contains 50 chronicles. "It was the way to find a guiding thread to unite various experiences and learning that had a conductive thread for my life." Behold, in the last book of the trilogy, 55 poems, organized into three parts, namely “exhibitions, permanences and returns” are gathered. They are “a synthesis of all my route,” he says. “Gray Flowers” ​​is “Perhaps the most autobiographical book of the three, as it is rooted in multiple feelings, in a kind of instantaneous ones that configured my days,” says the author. From the preface, by Maria João Cantinho, it is read that the first of the trilogy, “flowered by mistake the Brave roses” is “a book of brief stories, whose title was taken from loan to a beautiful verse (and a poem) of the melancholy Camilo Pessanha, in Clepsidra”. While "nomadic words" brings together chronic chronicles that are born "from his experience in Macao, as well as his traveler and adventurous aspect, as the Teotónio Almeida needed very praised." In turn, in the third, Dora Gago "changes the record and we find ourselves in the face of poetic and sensitive writing, built by brief poems," he reads. Maria João Cantinho also understands that the poem “Destiny” is one of the most beautiful in “Flowers of Gray”: “In the crazy run / of the abandoned / lonely Galgo of existing, lick the wounds of death / in the skin of the poem.” Here, it is described “poetic writing is presented as vertigo (‘ in the crazy race ’) driven by a allegorical impetus, in which the presence of death emerges”, where “fate is certainly this disadvantaged race in which death surrounds the living and only the poem can save or redeem those”, considers Maria João Cantinho. For this, "Dora Nunes Gago's writing contains a reflective dimension, addressing topics such as the creation or passage of time, among many others, and using a rich, vocabulary and prosodic level language in the search for effects that accentuate the tension of the poem." “Exiles”, the first part of the work, starts with “beginning”, a simple name for a short poem: “I follow the memory footprints / inscribed in the sand of time / and I am a ship / anchored without leme / no breath”. Perhaps marked by longing and distance, we find “absence”: “They dance solemn ashes / Silvando Winds of Saudade, / Heavens / Spelled / In Blood / Solitude.” And as this book is made of comings and goings, the work ends with "return", as if it was a timeline: "Returning the house / tattooing hills and valleys / in the retina, / watering the flowers of gray / reborn / in stony cracks / of hope." Dora Nunes Gago is a native of São Brás de Alportel and is currently a teacher at the Setúbal Polytechnic Institute. About “Nomadic Words”, the Jury of the Grand Prix of Travel Literature Maria Ondina Braga, granted by the Portuguese Writers Association (APE), considered it to be a “work of varied and rich observations concerning the places where the reports of great sensory livelihood, which do not lack the intimate look at places and people designating as 'Génie du Lieu' ”. "In a prose of great fluidity, eavized of reflections where perceptions, memories, culture, literature and history are intersected, the author has been able to lead a reading reading from the first pages, whose rhythm and interest can maintain throughout the considerable extension of the work," said the same jury.

item.title: LAG 2025 | Checks, economy and great bay should be sam hu fai bets
item.description:
The government lines for this year are presented on Monday, marking the debut of Sam Hou Fai in one of the most anticipated moments of the local political calendar. Game recipes and economic predictions should be on the table, according to José Sales Marques and Lou Shenghua. The future of pecuniary checks may be another matter to be in attention
Sam Hou Fai has been in the government for almost five months and is preparing to present, next Monday, his first report of the Governing Action Lines (LAG) for this year. Great expectations often reside in the amounts of pecuniary checks, the values ​​attributed to social support and other budgetary predictions, especially after the territory has been through a hard economic period with Covid-19. LAG 2025 should focus on these themes, and Macao's integration into the various regional cooperation projects, such as Hengqin Island or the Great Guangdong-Hong Kong-Macau Bay. Fulfilling the annual tradition of local politics, Sam Hou Fai made the usual round of auscultations to local associations, in order to know his opinions on the main measures to take. Listened to by HM, economist José Sales Marques expects clarity in the policies announced at the economic level. "I would like to see these LAG bring greater clarity on economic policies and the vision for the future of MSAR. I speak of structural measures that encourage the trust of the private investor, and that also realize such reforms of public administration to increase efficiency and effectiveness," he said. Sales Marques also said that "I would like to clearly see Macao's positions and priorities in his relationship with countries and regions of the world, including measures that lead to deepen the role of Sino-Midfone Platform and the Base of Multicultural Dialogue." Lou Shenghua, a political analyst and professor at Macao Polytechnic University (UPM), said the main ideas presented will be in accordance with what Sam Hou Fai presented in the electoral program. "The tonic can be placed in improving the effectiveness of governance, moderate economic diversification, the construction of the Hengqin cooperation zone and the issues related to the subsistence means of people," said the analyst, stressing that "citizens may be more concerned with subsistence -related issues." And what program presented Sam Hou Fai in September last year, when it was glimpsed that he would be the only candidate for the position of Chief Executive? A program that has as its “maximum objective to meet citizens' expectations for a better life” and the “fundamental orientation of implementing the principle of a country, two systems” in a full, correct and firm way ”. The importance of national security was not forgotten, referring to the need for defense “of sovereignty, security and interests of the country's development”. About the sin, Sam Hou Fai said he wanted to erect a "macao based on the rule of law, dynamic, cultural and happy." The then only candidate to head the government promised to improve the government's governing capacity. "We will strive to raise the capacity and level of governance of MSAR, the change in the concepts of governance, the optimization of the form of governance, the persistence of macao governance in accordance with the law, and the deepening of the reform of public administration and the legal system." Thus, he said "optimizing forms of governance, giving greater importance to the role of advisory bodies, experts and academics, and love associations of the country and Macao, widely listening to the opinions and suggestions of various sectors, different industry branches and various social strata." It remains to be seen if the lag will bring these tin aspects to the field of actions and concrete measures. MATE On Monday, the agenda continues as usual in the presentation of a report of the lag. First Sam Hou Fai will go to the Legislative Assembly, from 15h, make a general presentation to the deputies of political and budgetary issues essential for this year, followed by a press conference. The next day, it is a day of debate in the hemicycle on the same report, then followed the sectoral debates with all secretaries until the 30th of this month. One of the political themes that have been in the DAY ORDER is the value of pecuniary checks and whether or not they are attributed to residents living outside Macao. There are analysts to defend the reformulation of the program, but Sales Marques recalls that "the amount expected for pecuniary checks in the budget discussion for 2025 is 10,000 patacas for permanent residents." “Predicted budget revenues were based on calculation a gross revenue forecast of 240 billion patacas to an average of 20 billion per month. It turns out that the effective revenues obtained until the end of the first quarter of this year were short, with a deviation of less than four billion. be hit. ” Given these less optimistic predictions, referred to by the Secretary himself for the economy and finance, Tai Kin IP last week, Sales Marques believes that, if there are adjustments in the checks, will be "small". "As for the distribution method, I predict that it remains the same," he said. Lou Shenghua believes that "the pecuniary reimbursement plan may change." "In terms of amount, it is likely to maintain the value of ten thousand patacas per resident, but as for the form, it can be attributed to consumer valleys," he said. Last day 1, Secretary Tai Kin IP said the budget accounts are still short of expected. "We noticed that in the first three months of 2025 the gross revenues of the games reached 57.66 billion patacas, remaining the value almost unchanged annually, not yet reaching the expected monthly average of 20 billion patacas." Thus, it was left the warning that "this year's financial revenues may not be as optimistic as it is expected", and it is necessary to "seriously study the future economic situation and persist in the management of financial resources with prudence." Game and other stories Regarding the game sector, which has continued to have a predominant weight in the economy, Sam Hou Fai confirmed a month ago that concessionaires and satellite casinos have until the end of the year to prepare the transition to a subconsers' exploration model. It will be in the "hands" of the dealers to decide whether or not to explore these casinos directly. For Sales Marques, this dossier “worries several sectors of society, not only about the use of its workers, but also for the repercussion that will close in the areas of the city where they are, especially in retail and restoration trade, small trade in general”. Thus, "it will be prudent to avoid great shocks in the current conjuncture." "Everything will be done to regularize these units under the law in force, without provoking their immediate closure," he added. item.title: LAG 2025 | Governo quer criar plataforma integrada de formação profissional
item.description:
In the debate on the government lines for this year, the Chief Executive highlighted the initiative to create an “integrated vocational training platform” for young people who have difficulty finding their first job. Of the 7,100 unemployed, about 4,000 are young people, said the ruler
There is structural unemployment in Macao and this is “notorious”. Representative NGAN Iek Hang raised the issue in yesterday's debate about the Government Action Lines (LAG) report and demanded concrete measures to the government. "Many young people have difficulty finding work in their area of ​​specialization, and many residents have tightened their belt and have been more prudent in spending. How will I improve employment support with a multidimensional approach, ensuring the use of residents?" Sam Hou Fai, in his narrow as chief executive to present the lag and discuss them with the deputies, announced the creation of an “integrated vocational training platform” that includes government secretariats, local associations and companies to make specific courses depending on the needs of the business environment. “Currently, the unemployment rate is 2.4 percent, about 7,100 unemployed, and four thousand are young. It is a structural unemployment and it is a situation that has emerged in the last two years. There are many specific courses finalists, such as medicine, which cannot find employment. We want to have the companies for a combination and an integrated platform for vocational training and continuous development, to see if it is possible to resolve this structural unemployment For areas, ”he said. Sam Hou Fai also added that the proposal came from the secretary for the economy and finance, Tai Kin IP. "We also have to rely on the secretary's protection O LAM [Social Affairs and Culture], because it also has to do with education. Regarding the accreditation and professional certification, it is necessary to count on government participation, associations and companies, and the next stage is to create this integrated platform taking into account the experiences of neighboring territories," he said. Attention to satellite casinos Sam Hou Fai also recalled the unemployment resulting from the possible closure of satellite casinos as an example of the need for specific courses depending on the needs of the local economy. "Regarding the satellite casinos, we will have to see in two or three months to know the needs of the unemployed and then we can organize specific actions for certain areas," he explained. The objective of the future integrated training platform is to “solve the problem of human resources”, given that hiring non-resident workers “is just a supplementary support measure that will be changed taking into account the transformation of Macao and its concrete situation”. The Chief Executive recalled the training actions that already exist between the Macao Workers' Federation of the Federation of Associations and the Directorate of Services for Labor Affairs, as well as the game operators. "We have to take into account the 1+4 diversification strategy and create courses that give diplomas. We have to rely on companies to combine efforts," he concluded.

item.title: Book | Mark O'Neill tells the history of Europeans in the early days of Hong Kong
item.description:
“Europeans in Hong Kong” is the 18th and new book by British writer and journalist Mark O'Neill, who lives in the neighboring region. At HM, he confesses that he began to write the history of the Irish, but the project eventually expanded. As such, it focused on the stories of Europeans who left their brand in Hong Kong, including Portuguese
Hong Kong, the city of banking, finance and commerce, a worldwide warehouse for centuries and a gateway to China. It has been the neighboring region throughout the time, since its institution, in 1841. Hong Kong has always been an international territory populated by Europeans of various nationalities, much more than the British who administered the territory until 1997. It was missing to tell its story, and British author and journalist Mark O'Neill, residing in Hong Kong since the late 1970s, now has it now with “European Europeans in Hong Kong], which even includes a chapter about the Portuguese. In another work that has just left the newsstands, the author confesses to HM who began to write the history of the Irish in Hong Kong, whose contribution to the "was huge" territory. This work was not published, being born later the idea of ​​doing something bigger. “I chose the figures that made the greatest contributions, especially at the religious level, or teachers, writers, great figures in the business world and those whose legacies still last,” he confessed. Mark O'Neill points out that the great contribution of Europeans in the neighboring region took place in the educational area, but not only. "The most lasting contribution was given by schools, universities, hospitals, homes of elderly, social assistance institutions and some companies. Although they are entities that are currently managed, largely, by people from Hong Kong, were founded and fueled by Europeans." The author explains that the most impressive story associated with the legacy of the French arises on the cover of the book. "In the nineteenth century, the French nuns adopted tens of thousands of Chinese girls who had been abandoned and gave them a good life. Without them, girls would have died or worked as child labor, maids or prostitutes," he said. Another house Asked about the new perceptions that the book can bring to the general public, Mark O'Neill understands that he is today "familiar with the history of British in Hong Kong, but not with the history of continental Europe." Thus, the author says he hopes that "the book will help them understand their history, especially their contribution." In general terms, "in the early decades [of the Hong Kong Foundation], Europeans were, above all, business men and missionaries, both Catholic and Protestants." Then the region grew “as a great Asian city and, from the 1950s, the community expanded.” "Currently, we have architects, engineers, musicians, teachers, restaurant owners, doctors, lawyers, art and people experts in all the domains of life," said the author. Another prominent figure in “Europeans in Hong Kong” is the Jesuit Hungarian Father Laszlo Ladany, considered the “China's greatest observer in the world for thirty years”, and Anders Nelson, “Swedish singer and long-standing resident in Hong Kong, well known to local inhabitants”, describes the introduction of the work. “Most people think that Hong Kong was built by the Chinese during their 150 years of British dominance, which is not entirely accurate. As the reader will discover, many of the schools, social assistance institutions, buildings and companies in the city were founded and managed by people from Europe (defined here as 'east of calais'). They forced it, ”is described in the same introduction. Mark O'Neill also describes that the Hong Kong cemeteries contain traces of this presence, as "Europeans have enjoyed the city and their people more than their homeland." The European presence increased in the neighboring region from 1949, when the People's Republic of China is founded, as "the new Chinese government closed the doors to foreigners, with the exception of a small number of people from other socialist countries." Thus, "eager to remain in China and in the Chinese world, many Europeans have moved from mainland China to Hong Kong," he is mentioned. The Macaense Legacy The fourth chapter is entirely dedicated to the Portuguese and Macaense Hong Kong community, regarded as a “pillar of society” for many years. “For 150 years, the Portuguese were, after the British, the largest non-Chinese community in Hong Kong,” reads the work, which draws the profile of five personalities and describes two social clubs where the community was. Regarding the personalities, the example of José Pedro Braga, the first Portuguese to be part of the Legislative Council, between 1927 and 1937; Sir Roger Lobo, member of the Executive Council between 1967 and 1985; and Commander Arnaldo de Oliveira Sales, first president of the urban council between 1973 and 1981. “Os portugueses desempenharam um papel fundamental no Governo, nos bancos, nas profissões liberais e nas empresas comerciais. Viveram aqui durante muitas gerações. A maior parte dos expatriados ficava apenas o tempo da sua missão; quando se reformavam, partiam e regressavam à Grã-Bretanha ou a outro país da Europa. Os portugueses, por outro lado, tinham as suas próprias escolas, igrejas, clubes sociais e desportivos e a sua própria língua”, refere-se no book. Regarding the origin of this community, it is described as a “mixed race”, or macanese, but also Portuguese with Asian origins. “Its history dates back to hundreds of years, in the early days of Portuguese trade and exploitation. In the 16th century, Portugal established commercial warehouses and religious missions in Goa, Malaca, Macau and Nagasaki. The Portuguese settlers married local women, creating a mixed root population in India, Malaysia, China and Japan. In 1639, the Japanese government expelled all foreigners and foreigners and isolated the country from the rest of the world. ” Macao emerges closely linked to this community, as it became, in the mid-16th century, “the basis of Portugal in East Asia” after the Dutch blocked Goa and won Malacca. "The Macanese began to form as a cohesive community-sharing ties with Portugal, the Catholic religion, a common language and kitchen and a feeling of distinction from the Portuguese colonials and their Chinese neighbors. They were the only people in Macao who spoke Portuguese and Cantonese, giving them a role of intermediaries essential for the proper functioning of government and business," he is explained. The fact that “the Hong Kong foundation has devastated the economy of Macao” made many macanese began to move from weapons and luggage to a much more brightly saving zone. After all, "just 66 kilometers away [Hong Kong] was the best deep water port in southern China within laws, administration and military protection in the largest empire in the world."

item.title: EPM | Paulo Rangel guarantees increased financial support after 11 years of cuts
item.description:
On a lightning visit to Macao, Portugal's Foreign Minister argued that the position that the country maintains in the European Union does not affect the relationship with China. During Paulo Rangel's visit, it was also announced that Sam Hou Fai should visit Portugal during the summer
He met with Sam Hou Fai, with counselors from the Portuguese communities, associative representatives, Portuguese educational institutions and entrepreneurs. Thus was the visit of Paulo Rangel, Minister of Foreign Affairs of Portugal, in the short visit to the MSAR, which took place on Friday. There are no passages in the Portuguese School of Macau (EPM) and the Consulate General of Portugal in the territory. In the late afternoon, Paulo Rangel also moved to Hong Kong to visit the exhibition “Lusas Stories”, dedicated to the Portuguese community of the territory, patent at the Hong Kong History Museum. In China, Paulo Rangel was present at the Boao Forum in Haião. In an interview with TDM, the minister assured that Portugal's relations with China remain good, denying that the country's position in the European Union's position (EU) can represent some kind of obstacle. "Anyone who thinks that Portugal's presence in the EU is harmful to Portugal's relationship with China, does not realize Portugal's relationship with China and does not realize the role of Portugal in the international picture. I realize that some people do not understand, but honestly we have to see it as more value. And this is seen like this," he said. One of the voices that criticized Portugal's position in relation to stories such as the issue of Huawei and Rede 5G was Amelia António, lawyer and president of the House of Portugal in Macau. “My expectation is not high. I would like the Minister, after visiting China, to say something friendly, as relationships have been very loose. I would like to see this relationship resumed as usual and also that we were not as followers of the EU positions, so fiercely, because we have very special interests and we have a very large Portuguese community. It should not be lost sight of, ”he told Paulo Rangel to Macao. A questão EPM In the interview given to TDM, Paulo Rangel also commented on the issue of EPM, stressing the points that were not on the agenda, namely the works of expansion of the facilities. "This question has not yet been addressed. There are, in fact, several questions that have to be detailed and resolved, and one or the other that have not yet been put on the table. We know that there is search for it, but and I am being totally transparent, it is a question that is not yet on the table." According to Lusa, Paulo Rangel also announced that the government increased financial support to the EPM, returning to the legally expected level after 11 years of cuts. "We just replaced the Portuguese contribution to the Portuguese School of Macao, which (…) had suffered a huge cut," Rangel said on Friday. The Portuguese State holds the majority (51 percent) of the capital of the EPM foundation, but since 2014 that Lisbon only contributed with 10 percent of school expenses, a decision taken under the Portuguese financial rescue program. EPM financing “is now at legal levels again and is the first time at the end of 11 years,” he said. Shortly thereafter, the chief of Portuguese diplomacy told reporters that "there was no reason, honestly, to have this cut and he remained." "We have increased five times this value [of EPM financing], so this is something that is highly significant from the commitment we have." "There are governments that really give importance to Macau and China and there are others who do not give, this is something that has to be said," lamented the minister, pointing his finger at the previous executive of the Socialist Party. The replacement of financing “is undoubtedly an important help” for EPM, which Rangel described as having a key role for Portugal in Macau. "We also have pleased ... that there have never been so many Portuguese students - and now I speak of students from the Chinese community - as there are today in multiple schools," added the leader. "It means that also the special administrative region [of Macau] has encouraged Portuguese teaching and knowledge of Portuguese, and this is something that can only bring good relations between the two sides," added Rangel. SAM in Portugal From the meeting with Sam Hou Fai, which also took place on Friday, came some ideas and opinions on “Bilateral Exchange and Cooperation in the Judicial, Economic-Commercial, Education, among others,” says an official note from the Social Communication Office. Sam Hou Fai led to the meeting topics such as “the most current development of the deepened cooperation zone between Guangdong and Macau in Henqing”, and remembered that “Paulo Rangel is the first foreign ministerial guardian he receives after the executive's head of the executive, a fact that reflects the good relations between Macao and Portugal with a longtime history”. The chief executive also pointed out that after December 20, 1999, Macau, "with strong support from the central government, has insisted on maintaining the principle of" a country, two systems ", preserving the continental legal system, the traditional culture and customs, as well as actively maintaining the connection and foster relations with Portugal." The ruler also said that "Macao has deepened the role of bridge and platform between China and Lusophone countries, continuously boosting the establishment of friendly relationships in the various areas of bilateral cooperation." Another novelty of this meeting was the information, advanced by Sam Hou Fai himself, which “expects to visit Portugal in the near future” without, however, a concrete date has been announced. Rangel announced that the chief executive of Macao is expected to visit Portugal "immediately before August or in September." "There is clearly here also an alignment of the priorities that is highly symbolic," said the diplomat, on the fringes of a meeting with the Portuguese community in Macau. Asked about the restrictions to Portuguese in accessing the resident status, Rangel said he spoke with Sam Hou Fai "on all the issues that are relevant to the relationship between Portugal and the MSAR." "But, as it is a dialogue that is underway, I have a duty to give the opportunity we can, with the questions that have been raised from one part and the other, now we have space and time to build solutions," he added. Rangel said that the "follow -up of dialogue" with Sam Hou Fai will take place at a meeting of the Portugal -Raem Joint Commission, "which will be organized in principle in the second semester here in Macao." Paulo Rangel also said, in an interview with TDM, that the visit of Marcelo Rebelo de Sousa, president of the Portuguese Republic, “will happen a little later”, precisely due to the marking of new elections in the country. Initially, the aim was that Marcelo Rebelo de Sousa came to Macao in June to commemorate Portugal, Camões and Portuguese communities. The visit should take place in the following months of summer, predicted Paulo Rangel. Encounters and mismatches Paulo Rangel also had a meeting with local associative representatives, including with the Portuguese communities counselor. Francisco Mannhão, president of the Macao Retirees, Reformed and Pensioners Association (Apomac), took the opportunity to talk about the bureaucracy that still exists in the relationship with the Caixa Geral de Retirement (CGA). "To dispatch a survival pension process takes six months and then the correspondence goes back and forth. Macao benches do not have Iban, and this, for example, delays the whole process. Whenever a process goes to CGA, they insist that they do not have the number of IBAN and NIF [Fiscal Identification Number], that most of the widows receiving survival pensions, do not have in Portugal." exemplified. Mannão also compliments to the Portuguese politician. "For a short time he was here, he showed concern. I liked the presence of the minister." In addition, Francisco Mannão stressed that “in a good time the Portuguese government appointed Alexandre Leitão to Consul”, also recalling the good work of the previous Portuguese consul, Vítor Sereno. "The consulate has never been as well functioned as now. The criticism made to our consul are unfair. There were our associates who told me to have been admired for making a marking and was attended the next day," he said. More bet on the language Another important point of Rangel's visit was the promise of the reinforcement of Mandarin teaching in Portugal. "With the Chinese authorities I made a point of saying that we will be very committed to teaching Chinese in Portugal." In the Chinese capital, Rangel met with Chinese counterpart, Wang Yi, before meeting with Chinese vice-minister, Ding Xuexiang, on Hailão Island, where the Boao Forum took place. "The situation today is much better than it was 20 years ago ... We have, in fact, a formation that we did not have at all," said Paulo Rangel. The formation of fluent people in Mandarin “is also decisive for our future”, but “it is not enough for the challenges we have ahead,” he warned. Lame

item.title: MNE | BIR OF PORTUGUESE AND EPM are topics to discuss with Paulo Rangel

Portugal must have a position to safeguard these interests.” Speaking to Lusa, the official made similar complaints. I have not seen things again as they were, and I think it was important that Mr. Minister explains what is the position," he said that Portugal does not have to "align faithfully with everything in Europe and, above all," Before the pandemic, he recalled the official, there was “permanent communication” and “much exchange” between the Portuguese and Chinese authorities. Today is noticeable a “hardening regarding the Portuguese” in macao immigration, Maria Amelia António declared, but not being able to affirm categorically whether the position is related to “this removal” between China and the West. As autoridades de Macau não aceitam desde o ano passado novos pedidos de residência no território para portugueses, para o “exercício de funções técnicas especializadas”, permitindo apenas justificações de reunião familiar ou anterior ligação ao território. Also Miguel de Senna Fernandes, lawyer and president of the Macanese Association, regrets the situation of the assignment of the BIR. "Of course, that Mand has its reasons and Macau is different, and there are other communities that are interested in staying in the territory. The Portuguese community, due to greater historical connection that has to the territory, is still another community, among others. As Portuguese we are, we would like to have greater flexibility," he admitted. The EPM case Another point that Amelia António and Miguel de Senna Fernandes want to see approached on Paulo Rangel's visit is the situation at the Portuguese School of Macau (EPM) and the lack of teachers. "I think you should see the school and make a little more awareness of the situation, although the EPM is not from its area. As a member of the government it is important to realize that this situation has been poorly conducted, because in Portugal has been gone after some conversations that have little to do with reality and only harm. If he realized a little more of the situation, it would not be bad," said Amelia António. Already Miguel de Senna Fernandes says that it is time for the Portuguese executive to stop looking at the school as another Portuguese educational institution abroad. “EPM is always a recurring question, and it all depends on how the Portuguese state looks at school: if you look like any Portuguese school spread around the world, this is a mistake. There is no possible comparison, because the EPM emerged in a very special context.” However, to Lusa agency, Jorge Neto Valente, president of the EPM foundation, was categorical: the school “has nothing to peddling” to Paulo Rangel. "There is no whimper, we have nothing to do, we have nothing to demand, everything is normal," he said. The lawyer and president of the founding of the EPM said Rangel hoped "take a correct perception of the school, what it is for, the goals he has." “It's always good to have direct knowledge, it's much better than in papers,” said Neto Valente. "We have to account that the school is fulfilling the role that is expected to play," added the leader, recalling that the Portuguese State holds the majority of the capital of the EPM foundation. Still on the EPM universe, Miguel de Senna Fernandes, who also leads the Macanese Instruction Promoting Association (Apim), suggested a close look at the Chinese teaching in the EPM. "I have always advocated that Cantonese must have status. Because students, when they leave school, are in a singing world. This with all the merit that can have teaching in Mandarin," he said. "It is an issue that should be posed. It is a delicate question, because we are talking about an official language," he added, referring to Mandarin, an official language in China. The official, also vice president of the EPM foundation, admits that this is not a question that generates consensus -"many parents do not agree with this view" -but stresses that the learning of Cantonese "is a vehicle of integration", as it is the dominant language in the territory. Yes to the electronic vote Also to Lusa several associative leaders defended the transition to electronic vote, stressing embarrassment in the current options for emigration. "As long as it is not advanced without being tested, I am fully in agreement. The future is this and we have to point out," said the president of the CPM. In legislative elections, the Portuguese abroad have the possibility of exercising the right to vote in person or by post, while in presidential and European, the vote is in person. In the choice of correspondence, the government sends the address indicated in the census notebook the voting report and two envelopes, one green and one white, which must be returned to the Ministry of Internal Affairs after filling. The electronic option “can offer greater security”, defended Maria Amelia António. "With the consulates to work badly, in order to have few employees, with their work, and in countries where they are far from the places where people live, it is very difficult for people to vote personally. There has also been a lot of failures in the guarantees of receiving vote [via mail]," he added. The electronic choice is a longstanding claim of the Portuguese Communities Council (CCP). Rui Marcelo, president of the Regional Council of the Portuguese Communities of Asia and Oceania, who has a meeting scheduled with the Portuguese Foreign Minister, said that the “theme is already part of the CCP agenda“ a few years ago and has been approached several times and with several governments ”. "With the advancement of technology and the possibility of implementing security systems that can ensure vote safety - which happens today through the provision of services in other areas of the government also - the conditions are created so that we can eventually evolve into a situation where it can obviously be a complement, but not a substitute," he noticed. In February, the Portuguese Parliament approved a resolution proposed by the PSD to test the electronic vote in emigration. The President of the Portuguese Republic, Marcelo Rebelo de Sousa, suggested in December a pilot electronic voting experience in the circles of emigration. The head of Portuguese diplomacy arrives in Macau today after passing by Beijing and Haikou, in the province of Haião, where he was present at the Boao Forum. item.title: Au Kam San accuses al with obstructing access by journalists
item.description: Former Deputy Au Kam San considers that the Legislative Assembly (AL) is “obstructing journalists' access to the coverage of plenary meetings. The position was taken through a Facebook post in reaction to a video published by the newspaper All Abou Macau. In the images you can see a newspaper reporter, at first, to be prevented from circulating on the outside of the plenary room. Later, the same reporter tries to question Al and the Executive's employees about the fact that he cannot enter a room where a session opened to the public. Since Sam Hou Fai won the elections, the All Abou Macau newspaper has been prevented from participating in press conferences, usually justifying that the places are all busy, when they are not. This type of obstruction has now been extended to the Plenary of the Legislative Assembly, where meetings are open to the entire population. However, the journalists of the publication, although they were not the last to arrive, were taken to a separate room, where they were allowed only to watch the session through the television broadcast. The same treatment was applied to at least one member of the public. Intentional obstruction This aspect was criticized by Au Kam San: "When the Legislative Assembly prevents journalists from entering the Plenary Room […] is actually to deliberately obstruct interviews with the media," he said. "Watching video sessions has many limitations, the camera can only be directed to the speaker at most, but what reporters have to do is not only to capture the speaker's expression in front of the House, but also expressions of other non-speakers, such as relevant employees or other deputies, who can become extremely important news materials," he added. The former deputy also considered that this practice is new in the hemiciclo, which has never been seen since the time of Portuguese administration, and that the explanation that journalists do not need access to the main room is "insulting".

item.title: Electronic Cigarettes | LAM LON WAI WANTS TOTAL PROHIBITION
item.description:
The deputy of the workers asked the government to have a deadline for the ban on electronic cigarettes, and argues that smoking is prohibited at the door of restaurants and residential buildings, busy streets and outdoor areas near schools and kindergartens.
Lam Lon Wai wants to know when the government will prepare a bill to fully prohibit the use of electronic cigarettes. The issue is part of the latest written interpellation of the deputy linked to the Federation of Macao Workers Associations (Faom). In the interpetement, the deputy indicates that "the latest inquiries" show that "Macao young people are increasingly using electronic cigarettes." In the optics of Lam Lon Wai, this type of cigarettes is dangerous because "it has been used for drug use in neighboring regions." Therefore, the deputy asks if the authorities will "do what they said before and propose new changes to the smoking control law." Lam Lon Wai also asks the government to refer to what situation are the work to prohibit electronic cigarettes and to present a calendar for the approval of the measure and its entry into force. Since 2022 a ban on entry or exit of the territory of electronic cigarettes is in force. Infringers risk paying a fine that can reach 4,000 patacas. However, if electronic cigarettes are in Macau can be used. And this is an aspect that Lam Lon Wai wants to see punished. More Tobacco Free Areas In order to control tobacco consumption, Lam Lon Wai also intends that the government advances with the creation of more cigarette -free areas near schools, hospitals and other public facilities. "Residents are not satisfied with tobacco policies and say it is difficult to avoid passive smoke. They also expect authorities to continue to pay more attention, widening the zones of smoking and reinforcing advertising and law enforcement," wrote the legislator. According to the deputy's proposal, health authorities should consider applying smoking prohibitions in places such as residential buildings, restaurants and busiest streets and even private cars, when they are children, as it says it is increasingly frequent in Hong Kong. In addition to prohibitions, Lam suggests greater effort to help people smoke, with the creation of clinics and increasing inspection and punishment. "Especially with regard to the healthy growth of young people, it takes more preventive education about tobacco and alcohol […] and increasing young people's awareness of self -protection and we will establish a solid foundation for the project of a healthy macao," he said.

This is how the Institute of Social Action (IAS), through President Hon Wai, responded to an interpellation of Ho Ion Sang on the subject. However, the president of IAS considers that the work done so far to elaborate the new legislation were "positive". The early directive, also known as an early decision or vital will, is a choice that can be taken by citizens to refuse some specific types of treatment in the future. A practical example of your application may be when a person is in brain death, but with vital functions only artificially ensured. The early directive may establish a person's will not be linked to the machines. The choice is allowed in regions and countries such as Portugal, Spain, Germany, South Korea, Israel, Singapore, the United States, Canada, among others. The question arises after Hong Kong legislated on the subject, and the Macao authorities put the possibility of advancing in this regard in 2021, including the creation of a study group. However, in view of HO issues, the government considers that there are still no conditions [to submit the proposal of law], although preliminary legislative comparison work was “positive”.
