item.title: Beijing, Hong Kong and Macau accuse the US of attacking China's survival
item.description: The Chinese Communist Party's main official for Hong Kong and Macao affairs and governments of both regions yesterday accused the United States of imposing tariffs to sabotage China. "The US has targeted our tariffs, they target our own survival," said Xia Baolong, director of the Hong Kong and Macau affairs, under the tutelage of the State Council. "Although Hong Kong is the largest source of US commercial surplus, the United States still imposed high tariffs. This is extremely arrogant and blatant," said Xia. "The US cannot tolerate Hong Kong's prosperity and stability and are the biggest sinister manipulator that undermines human rights, freedom, the rule of law, prosperity and stability in Hong Kong," the leader added. Xia spoke in a pre-recorded speech, transmitted during the inauguration of an exhibition in Hong Kong, regarding the National Security Education Day. “Whoever tries to lead us back to poverty and weakness is our enemy,” warned the leader. "Those who betray national interests and cheer for the enemy at critical times will never be tolerated," he added. Chief Words Today, at the same ceremony, Hong Kong's government leader John Lee Ka-Chiu accused the United States of, in a "wicked logic," imposing tariffs to protect his "unhealthy hegemony." "The United States oppose free trade, interrupt global trade and supply chains (…), severely damaging the multilateral trade system and the process of globalization," said John Lee. The chief executive has assured that Hong Kong "will keep his status from Porto Franco with basically null fees" and will file a complaint against the United States to the World Trade Organization. Also the leader of the Macao government yesterday criticized the United States for the "abusive imposition of customs taxes on all its business partners," including China, "under several pretexts." Also during the inauguration of an exhibition due to National Security Education Day, Sam Hou Fai said Washington "severely devastated the multilateral trade system (...) and damaged the stability of the world economic order."

item.title: Sam Hou fai fear deficit but will review budget to reinforce support
item.description:
The new Macao government leader admitted yesterday to fear a deficit in 2025, due to the slowdown in the game's revenues, but reiterated that he will review the region's budget to reinforce social support. "I am worried, if game revenues only reach 15 billion [of Patacas per month], it may result in a budget deficit," Sam Hou Fai told the deputies. It is recalled that Ho Iat Seng had predicted game revenues of 240 billion patacas by 2025, or 20 billion per month. But in the first three months of the year, Macao casinos registered total revenues of 57.7 billion patacas, below the Government target, despite an increase of 0.6 percent compared to the same period of 2024. “We have to have a feeling of risk,” warned Sam Hou Fai, during the debate on the Government Action Lines (LAG) to 2025, in the Legislative Assembly. Basic law requires public accounts to remain on positive land. The government leader recalled that China - by far the main source of tourists to Macau - fell into deflation (annual fall of consumer prices) in March for the second consecutive month, "but savings increased." Sam Hou Fai argued that these data show that the Chinese population also has "a feeling of risk", which was already before the new US president, Donald Trump, start a trade war with China.
Tamanho é relativo On Monday, at the press conference after the LAG presentation, the chief executive admitted that Trump's tariffs will have a "more indirect" impact on Macao. Sam Hou Fai pointed out as probable consequences the decrease, both of the consumption of local families and a break in the number of visitors and consumption, especially in case of devaluation of the Renmimbi. Still, the government leader guaranteed yesterday that he will review the budget to 2025, prepared by the predecessor, for measures such as the creation of a fund, worth 10 billion patacas, to support small and medium enterprises. Sam Hou Fai admitted that current expenses, social support and public function, “will only increase, not decrease” but preferred to focus on the diversification of public revenues. In the first two months of 2025, taxes on the game represented 89.3 percent of Macao government current revenues.

item.title: Embarrassed teachers
item.description: Teachers are study, knowledge, culture, dedication and suffering. There are no two equal teachers. Some female and others in the masculine. In Portugal we attend teachers, with children, to be placed 300 kilometers from home. To reach the teaching site and not have the minimum conditions of habitability. Teachers are the fundamental of the formation of our children. Many parents do not understand that the formation of their descendants has to do with teachers and that education has to be done within the family. Teachers must have been the professional class that was the most impaired and more manifestations of protest for many years. Their protests aimed to correct the situation of thousands of teachers who were surpassed in their career by colleagues with less time of service. Since 2018, about 50,000 teachers have not been properly repositioned, resulting in the placement of teachers with the same time of service at different echelons, due exclusively to legal norms. The teachers always stressed that they did not fight for more money, but for justice. There were teachers who were over 30 years old on the 10th level when they should have been placed in the seventh level. Last year, a gigantic demonstration with teachers from all over the country was held in Lisbon, at a meeting held by the National Federation of Teachers (FenProf) and leader Mário Nogueira argued that it was necessary to create a more attractive career that kept those still in schools and attracted young people and those who chose to abandon the profession ahead of time. Teachers through their representatives have gained some claims. However, schools remain places of great concern. Students have lost respect for teachers and there have been several cases of violence in which students assault teachers. It is not easy to be a teacher these days. However, last week the whole class of teachers must have been very embarrassed. And it's sad to know of embarrassed teachers. Why? Because it was disclosed on social networks that a teacher had an ignoble behavior of pure racism. The teacher, from very young students, asked everyone present in class to assert what they dreamed of their adulthood. The students were answering what they thought and when it came to a student with African roots, the teacher returned: "You, it is not worth talking because the so -called your color end up in alcohol and misery ...". There was a sepulchral silence in the classroom and the African kid got up and said: “The teacher is very mistaken. You will end in misery very first that I know that I was orphaned and was adopted by a very rich family, my grandparents are very rich and my parents are very rich and I am the grandson and the only child that I will receive several fortunes…”. This case has shocked many communities and many teachers have been embarrassed because it is inadmissible for a teacher to be racist to the point of being able to traumatize a student for the rest of his life. Racism exists, always existed. But a teacher cannot give such a negative example of the true training function in a classroom. Racism is fought for how many human and democratic rights argue. In Portugal we have an far right party with racist laivos. Possibly the teacher in question is electing this party. It is hardly believed that a teacher rejects the word of a "black" student just because he is "black" and tells him that he will end up in alcohol and misery like all "blacks". The teacher showed not having the least knowledge of the world around her or is really radical racist. We have millionaire Africans, lawyers, engineers, architects, doctors, journalists, deputies, leaders of large companies, police, all excellent and, fortunately, we have Portuguese of African origin in most professions. This teacher cannot continue to embarrass his colleagues. The teacher has to be the subject of a disciplinary process that aims to be expelled from the profession and the parents of the offended young man should move a criminal case against the teacher through court. This was a regrettable case and the question is: how many more similar cases will happen through schools across the country? Such a discrimination, so serious, should not go unpunished and the school principals must have the complete knowledge of what kind of teachers they have in their schools so they can end with inadmissible facts as we have reported. Ai, Portugal, Portugal… PS - In previous chronicle we wrote about the illegalities that took place in Portuguese prisons. Last week, the Judiciary Police carried out a mega operation in several arrests and two prison guards and a PSP agent were connoted with the entry of drugs and mobile phones in the prisons.

item.title: Macau, the story well told
item.description: On April 14, the Chief Executive, Sam Hou Fai, will present the “Report of Government Action Lines for the Financial Year 2025”, exactly a week after Black Monday, during which Hang Seng's Index Hang Kong sank to 13.74 percent. The biggest challenge of the chief executive is to build a positive narrative about Macao in the government line report, so that citizens can have a feeling of gain, happiness and security. Telling a story well and doing something well done are two distinct concepts of two different levels. For example, when a seller tries a customer to buy a car, he will discuss the superiority of quality and vehicle performance that, in addition, will be very appealing. However, when the buyer finally uses the car may see that what the seller said was a beautiful story. The saying “practice is the only test to the truth” remains valid. I appreciate the honesty of the current secretary for the economy and finance, which made it clear that the revenues of the 2025 fiscal year may not come to expect expectations. After Macao was released from the Covid-19 pandemic, the full recovery of his economy is dependent on the efforts of the current RAE government. Faced with the current situation of Macao, the RAE government cannot use the apologies of the complexity and motility of the international scenario and the existence of several unstable internal factors to dodge their responsibilities. After all, under the guiding principle “Macau governed by patriots”, the weak governance of Macau is a problem of those in power. Thus, I hope that in your first report of the governance line lines, Sam Hou Fai can really outline a way to carry out the main points proposed in its political program during the election campaign, including: “work, oriented to people's subsistence”, “distribution of revenue,“ urban development, oriented to people's subsistence ”and“ safeguard safety, crucial to people ”. By effectively using the institutional advantages of Macao as a business opportunities platform, the MSAR government can write a new chapter in the practice of “a country, two systems” and transform Macau into a happy city. The presentation of the “Report of the Governing Action Lines for the Financial Year 2025” is of great importance to Macau. The 15th National National Games of R.P. of China are also an important event of this year, which Macau will organize and host in conjunction with Guangdong and Hong Kong, but even more important will be the elections for the 8th Legislative Assembly of MSAR, scheduled for September 14. As in 2025 there will be elections for the Hong Kong Legislative Council and the Legislative Assembly of MSAR, it is important to be successful, particularly the choice of MSAR Legislative Assembly, elected by direct suffrage, to demonstrate the success of the realization of the concept “a country, two systems”, which “Hong Kong is governed by Hong Kong people”. and "Macao is governed by Macao people" and by the guiding principle "Hong Kong governed by Patriots" and "Macau ruled by patriots." The story about the elections for the 8th Legislative Assembly of MSAR should not only be well told, but must also be well executed to obtain the confidence of the central government. Because you receive a concert does not mean that the public will attend, because it depends on who acts. For the election of deputies for direct suffrage to the 2025 Legislative Assembly, I provide for more than 14 lists of applications, considering the efforts currently developed by various associations and the inclusion of list of candidates for the election of deputies for direct suffrage to the 2021 Legislative Assembly that were not elected. Permanent residents of the Special Administrative Region of Macau have the right to elect and be elected, under the law. These rights are guaranteed to them by the Macao Basic Law.

According to a press release released by the organization, artists “use digital photography, interactive digital sound installations, computerized painting and invisible paint” to make a new interpretation of the “ecological wisdom contained in the 24 solar terms”, creating a new artistic vocabulary. In the same note it is described that the works exposed “simulate natural light and shadow effects through virtual lighting techniques, creating the aesthetics of spring beauty”. “Real -time sound data is also used to conduct facilities through which the public can experience the rhythm of coexistence” of all exposed elements. This “interdisciplinary creation breaks with the traditional narrative forms of art, exploring issues of technology and sustainable development,” says the organization, which also says to “provide the public with a cyclical philosophical experience” based on rain power and the idea that “rain nourishes all grains”. Thus, "contemplation of the relationship between technology and nature is encouraged while appreciating art." Various dimensions Patent until May 28, this show was organized by the CAC - Circle of Macao Culture Friends, with Cindy Ng Sio Ieng as curator. Cindy Ng Sio Ieng indicates that the exhibition refers to the final period of spring, "with the arrival of the" grain rain "station, when it reveals a poetry of its own season that" flows around the world. " In this show there are “virtual light and shadow that simulate the dance of nature”, while the use of sound data by artists in real time serves “to boost the rhythm of coexistence”. In the case of artist Wang Tou Kun, born in Macau, digital photography is the means used to express itself artistically. Graduated from the University of Massachusetts Dartmouth, with specialization in digital media and photography, the artist expresses his personal experiences, both at the time and in the environment, and explores “the relationship between reality and virtual through digital media processing, in a concept that describes as 'post-photography'”. In this show at the SCM Wang Tou Kun hostel presents “The Interconnected Nature Forest Shadow”, inspired by the very environment of the Patio do Albergue SCM, a space in the middle of the São Lazaro neighborhood, with old trees. Thus, there are images “in fluid layers of transparent fabric”, in which the trees mirror “dancing shadows” and “the cracks of the brick walls and the veins of the leaves” interconnect. The artist also presents the series of images “9+2: Kunyu Wanguo Quantu”, focused on the 11 cities that make up the area of ​​the Great Bay. “Using website screen catches, the artist extensively collects images related to these cities,” then resorting to “digital collage techniques, skillfully fusing the screen captures to build a surreal landscape of interconnected cities,” the organization describes. Chon Iap Lam, another participating artist, is a designer of theater lights and presents the work “Two-Dimensional Tree”, where he uses light and shadow facilities “to deconstruct the relationship between ancient trees and their shadows, as well as the two-dimensional and three-dimensional characteristics of the shadows”. Thus, “in the dream space created by the installation of light, the audience can feel the shadows of the trees to swing, as if immersed in a transparent fabric forest, surrounded by several tree silhouettes,” describes the curator of the show. With this work, Chon Iap Lam shows "the professional experience in light design, reflecting his exploratory spirit in the field of digital art." In turn, Xiaoqiao Li, a professor at the Hong Kong Metropolitan University Department of Creative Arts, presents digital animation work entitled “Phantom Terin: Landscapes Reimagined Through Gaussian Point Clouds”, where he employs 3D technology to create landscapes that explore the border between reality and virtual. Already the artist Kit Lei Ka Ieng presents “Unfold”, an interactive work that “uses coding to allow plant growth patterns to change in response to musical melodies, transiting perfectly between the forms of water droplets and crystals”. The artist has been dedicated to multimedia art, focusing on digital images, sound installations and new media.

item.title: History | Book about Americans in Macao in the 19th century presented today
item.description:
The book “To the Farthest Gulf for the Wealth of India - Macao Representations in the Peabody Essex Museum (Salem)”, by Rogério Miguel Puga, tells the story of Americans who lived in Macao in the nineteenth century. The Academic today presents in the Portuguese Bookstore the work that resulted from consultation with records stored in a museum in Salem, in the state of Massachusetts
Macao has long been a place of trade and experiences of people from around the world. One of the foreign communities that lived in the territory, in the busy nineteenth century, consisted of Americans, whose presence in Macao lasted in photographs, diaries, objects and paintings, present at the Peabody Essex Museum, in Salem, Massachusetts. These signs of the ostentation of life, wealth and business that Americans had in the territory were the subject of analysis by Rogério Miguel Puga. The academic linked to New University of Lisbon launched, in 2023, a book that resulted from years of investigation into this theme, entitled “To the Farthest Gulf for the Wealth of India - Macao Representations at Peabody Essex Museum (Salem)”. The author presents today the work in Macau, from 18:30, in a session in the Portuguese Bookstore. At HM, it tells a little about the long course of research and writing, which was supported by the Macau Foundation. "I started the book in Macao in 2009, but only in 2023 was released. It makes perfect sense to present the book in the city that is the subject of the investigation and where it was started." The academic states that today's presentation in the Portuguese bookstore is “doubly symbolic” because there is a collaboration with Ciela, a research center of the University of Macau (one), where Rogério Miguel Puga has presented some lectures on the themes of the book, dynamized by professor Mário Pinharanda Nunes. Today's session at the Portuguese Bookstore is moderate by Joshua Erlich, a professor at UM, “who also conducts research on the East India Company in India, thus communicating his work with my study on the British presence in Macau between 1635 and 1793, already published,” said Rogério Miguel Puga. The author confesses that the event also symbolizes a return to a territory that has not visited since 2019 and where it always finds new topics to study. ” "This time, I focused on the Portuguese presence in Hong Kong, after visiting the exhibition 'Lusy Stories' at the Hong Kong Museum of History, which I will soon publish a reception in Portugal," he told HM. The book presented today has been for sale at the Plaza Cultural Macau Bookstore, SENG KWong Bookstore (Starlight Bookstore) and the Macau Foundation's public information center. Show Macau to the World What objects were these and what did they serve? What useful did you have for Americans travelers in a time of rare and difficult communications? At a time when Macau was the only gateway to China, which did not allow residence to foreigners, they landed here to do business. Then, arrived in the US, showed Macao they had known. Rogério Miguel Puga discovered this universe when he visited the museum in 2005. “I realized that in one of the museum rooms were several representations of Macau. I found the connection [from the territory] to Salem curious. It was a picture identified as Macau, but it was, in fact, a representation of Shanghai. and other artists, ”he said in an interview conducted in 2023. At the Salem Museum there are objects such as fans, fitting tables, table tops, portraits, sewing tables with macao representations or portraits commissioned by Americans. Rogério Miguel Puga writes not only about these objects, but also about the historical context of the time, having also conducted research in cities such as New York, Philadelphia and Washington. However, it also takes place today, between 2:45 pm and 4 pm, at the Faculty of Arts and Humanities, the lecture “Anglo-Portuguese Relations and the British Presence in Macau (18th-19th centuries)”, the theme in the book. This is a session where we talk a little about the history of these western traders looking for Macao to do business with China, especially from 1700, when the Eastern Indian Company establishes direct trade relations with the country. In the lecture will also be mentioned the social and cultural interconnections that have taken place in these years between foreign traders and local populations.

item.title: Rui Cunha Foundation hosts book launch on buildings life
item.description: The Docomomo Macau Research Center has launched an invitation to present the book “How to prolong the life of buildings”, which results from a Macao Docomomo investigation into the most significant examples of twentieth -century modern architecture. The event is scheduled for April 23, at 6.30 pm, at the Rui Cunha Foundation and will be attended by architects Cecilia Chu, Bernard Brennan and Rui Leão, in a conversation moderate by Francisco Ricarte. According to the organizers, the will be “aiming to lead the importance of modern movement to public attention, authorities, professionals and the educational community concerned with the built environment, and promote the development of adequate conservation techniques and methods and disseminate this knowledge among the professions”. Throughout the conversation it will also be addressed the conservation of architectural heritage, which, according to the organizers, has as its background the increasingly intense threats. "In recent decades, the architectural heritage of the last century seemed more threatened than in any other period. This is mainly due to the fact that many of these masterpieces are not considered elements of heritage, their original functions changed substantially and their technological innovations did not always resist long-term tensions," he was communicated. "Once functional use can change over time, well -designed buildings are able to adapt to new types of use and prolong their usefulness when their durability goes beyond the role of their original tenant," he was added. Intervention voices Regarding speakers, Cecilia Chu is an associate professor at the School of Architecture at the Chinese University of Hong Kong, graduated in Urban History and with experience in design and conservation. Bernard Brennan is an associate of Wilkinson Eyre and assistant professor at the Faculty of Architecture at the University of Hong Kong (HKU). As a professional architect, he worked on a wide range of adaptive reuse projects in historical scenarios, recently including the state of State Theater in Hong Kong. In turn, Rui Leão is an architect whose practice covers architecture and urban planning projects, especially in Macau. It works in the teaching of architecture and in editorial works related to the areas of heritage and urbanism. He has a degree in Architecture from the Faculty of Architecture of Faup Porto, Portugal, in 1993, and has a doctorate in Architecture and Urbanism from RMIT, the Royal Melbourne Institute of Technology, Australia.

item.title: Traffic | Less road accidents in the first quarter
item.description:
In the first three months of 2025 there was a slight descent, 3.44 percent, of the number of road accidents, compared to 2024. Also noteworthy for the lack of respect for drivers with pedestrians on treadmills. Fines continue to increase, with particular incidence for parking lots
Macau registered, in annual terms, a drop in the number of road accidents in the first three months of 2025. This is what the data of the Public Security Police (CPSP) say, which show that in the first quarter there were 3,626 accidents, less 3.44 percent compared to the months from January to March 2024. Regarding fines for violation of traffic rules, CPSP instituted a total of 193,000 in the first quarter, which constitutes an increase of 12.8 percent compared to the same period last year. The fines involved an amount of 51.67 million patacas, plus 8.32 percent. Regarding parking in forbidden zones, there was also an annual increase, with 171,000 fines, 14.5 percent, while in illegal parking lots, the increase was 10.92 percent, and 154.517 thousand infringements were verified in the first three months. As for illegalities committed in charged parking zones, or places with a parking meter, the increase is higher, around 62 percent, with about 17,000 cases in the first quarter of this year. Another fact that stands out is the illegal driving infringements of motorcycles, that is, without proper driving license, with 68.18 percent of cases in annual terms. In the first quarter of this year 37 infractions of this kind were registered. Of the numbers released by CPSP also highlights the large increase in cases of drivers who did not respect the passage of pedestrians on the treadmills, in a total of 173 processes, plus 47 percent. But on the opposite side of the coin, the pedestrians also did not comply, with the authorities to record 2,400 cases. Still, the reduction was 20 percent compared to the first quarter of last year. LESS TAXIS CPSP data also show how taxi drivers perpetrated, with an annual increase of 2.2 percent, totaling 660 infractions in the first three months of the year. Regarding the infringement type, abusive charges of tariffs had an increase of another 116.67 percent compared to the first quarter of last year, while the refusal of transport arises in second place, with 53.57 percent of cases. However, the offense that dominates is the act of “not waiting in order of arrival customers in taxi squares”, with 436 occurrences in the first quarter of this year compared to 21 cases of 2024. This is an increase of 1976.19 percent. Regarding improper use of the taximeter, a break of 68.42 percent was registered, while “other irregularities” had an increase in the order of 220 percent, with a total of 660 occurrences in the first trimester compared to the 206 cases of the first quarter of 2024 Regarding the payment of fines, in 48 taxi drivers paid a total of 52,000 patacas, and only three taxi drivers saw their license canceled for excess infractions within a period of five years. The authorities also received, in the first quarter, 270 complaints filed by the public due to the bad service provided by taxi drivers, and 80 percent was related to attitude and behavior to customers.

item.title: Macauport | Profit of 565.8 thousand patacas last year

item.title: Death | Elaine Wynn, co-founder of the Wynn Resorts group died
item.description:
Elaine Wynn died last Tuesday at the age of 82. The co-founder of the Wynn Resorts Hotels and Casinos Group leaves a brand as a businesswoman, philanthropist and “tireless defender of Las Vegas, children and their education,” says the company that helped found
Billionaire and philanthropic businesswoman Elaine Wynn, co-founder of the Wynn Resorts Hotels and Casinos Group, died at 82, the company said. “As a co-founder and one of Wynn Resorts' greatest shareholders, he helped create and turn the company into one of the most beloved luxury resort brands in the world,” says the statement, not detailing the circumstances of his death. "He was a tireless defender of Las Vegas, children and their education, and the arts," adds the obituary, who says that the businesswoman recently celebrated the 20th anniversary of the Wynn Hotel in Las Vegas, and also created the Hotel Encore. Elaine Wynn, who was born in New York in 1943, adopted her ex-husband Steve Wynn's surname, the heir of Bingo Leste bingo halls, with whom he has been divorced twice and who, over 44 years, has helped to shape Las Vegas. Wynn have created the luxury chains Wynn Resorts and Mirage Resorts, and are attributed to the revitalization of the hotel zone known as the strip, including the Bellagio Hotel, with its famous source, or the Mirage Hotel, with its astonishing volcano. In Macao, where the operator started activities after the game liberalization, Wynn holds several game projects and integrated resort, namely Wynn Macau and Wynn Palace at Cotai, through the company Wynn Macau Ltd. In February Wynn Resorts was again recognized as one of the “most admired companies in the world”, a distinction attributed by Fortune magazine. Wynn Resorts received the highest rating for a casino resort, obtaining “a good score in the product / service quality category”, describes an official Wynn note about the distinction. Definitive divorce in 2010 The businesswoman definitely divorced Steve Wynn in 2010, but remained the largest individual shareholder of Wynn Resorts and also dedicated herself to philanthropic work, especially in arts and education, recall local media. Las Vegas political figures mourned his death, including Mayor Shelley Berkley, who said Elaine had planned an art museum in the city, and Nevada governor Joe Lombardo considered her a "visionary business woman." Personally, Elaine had two daughters with Moganta Steve Wynn, with whom she had a divorce that intensified when she was accused of sexual harassment in 2018, a scandal that forced him to withdraw from his company and which he suggested had been "instigated" by his ex-wife. According to Wynn Resorts annual report of 2024, published on December 31, Elaine Wynn had about 8.85 percent of the ordinary actions in circulation, being the second largest shareholder of the company, behind American billionaire Tilman Fertitta. According to Forbes magazine, Elaine Wynn's liquid heritage, in relation to this year, was $ 1.9 billion.

10/28/22 In a lunch with several guests I hear a friend, who declares himself a spiritist, explaining about the particularities of his belief, in a serene and balanced way, would even say, without "irrationalism". He discussed long and serenely, devoid of any fanatical proselytizing. “Here is someone to whom belief brought weighting!” I thought, a rare alliance. However, at one point a phrase that horrify me. He says, “There is no chance, nothing happens by chance!” And I enter the voracious fauces of holism. Because holismo has a pathological aspect like all good things, a side of shadow. Two examples: In Hinduism there is less sensitivity to existential dramas, if that child suffers in this life this is only an expression of the strict karmic symmetry, an effect of the acts she committed in her previous life. In Africa it is not accepted that death may have been accidental, and many women are accused by the dead family of having caused her husband's death, in an act of manifest dementia, and, in the blatant majority of cases, in a huge injustice to his wife - madness that spreads and infiltrates the social fabric. Buddhism has introduced compassion and Christianity to Caritas, trying to break with this logic, but in many other beliefs and religions the cage of causalities prevails over sensitivity to experience, the need to respond to the now. It is a tremendous logic that transforms the world into a platonic stage, where we are just the shadows of something -an inextricable law -in a determinism that calcines all singularities, but strangely fascinates many. The conquest of modernity has anchored in the conquest of chance and random, subtracting the incidences of a life to this fierce determinism that closed the world in a web. When the Renaissance freed the body from the influence of the stars, at this moment sexuality was relieved of guilt and individualism and their volition could emerge. There is an unequivocal moral implication in the phrase “There is no chance, nothing happens by chance!”, Which should work as a key to self-knowledge and self-judgment, but usually this phrase is managed to seek a reason for things abroad from us in the other. It is an alibi. There is a holistic temptation in the world today, as in the Middle Ages there was a satanic temptation, without great reflection on its consequences. Because it is not enough we want to connect everything in a resonant chain of affection. Even the most unexpected: affection itself can kill. I realize, thanks to this cultured, balanced, intelligent woman, that “the combat” moved at the beginning of this century. One of the great misconceptions of the twentieth century was the false dichotomy between "rationalism and irrationalism", a debate that extended to all fields, including art. First, rationality was confused (the positive side of reason) with rationalism (the pathological feature of reason), and articulated in this lack of discernment was confused irrationalism with freedom. Almost all the art of the twentieth century, with surrealism to the head, worked in this error. The fallacy still exists despite having consolidated the emergence of 'irrationalism' and the consequent relativist currents that followed it. Essentially much of what happened in the twentieth century, it turned around this shock between two paradigms: rationalism versus irrationalism. Now, I see, the indetermination, chance, the random of the terrible temptation of the causal cage. Holism, in its pathological feature, can be the reductionism that is the way it puts the way as a new 'eschatological narrative'. Is it "by chance" that the holism emerges at the moment when neo-liberalism and its cynical contempt for the human person besides all freedoms, all acquired rights? Holistic consciousness has brought positively a greater ecological awareness but followed by scholastic rigor drifting reality under the blanket of a determinism that is much more than inconvenience: all great authoritarian ideologies are holistic. My friend will know how to combine her holistic and transpersonal belief with the freedom and responsibility that every moment asks us - but how many will make the destruction, under a law that explains and encompasses? Quantos não se abandonarão ao que é? The awareness of the indeterminate brings tragic conscience, as the Greeks knew, but also brings the will and the courage of the decision. And of this we cannot abdicate. In addition, as Drummond shows in Carlos Drummond de Andrade's poem “Quadrilha”: "John loved Teresa who loved Raimundo/ who loved Maria who loved Joaquim who loved Lili/ who did not love anyone./ John went to the United States, Teresa to the convent,/ Raimundo died of disaster, Maria stayed to aunt,/ Joaquim suicide himself and Lili married J. Pinto Fernandes/ who had not entered the story." Real always runs outside the track, in full exteriority to our concepts. This is what is worth a J. Pinto Fernandes at the exact moment we thought we had everything under control.

item.title: Chinese economy grows 5.4% in the first quarter of 2025
item.description: The Chinese economy grew 5.4 percent in the first quarter of the year, according to official data spread yesterday, as manufacturers rushed orders before the customs rates in the United States. Growth is in line with the rhythm of expansion achieved by the world's second largest economy in the fourth quarter and exceeds the goal of “about 5 percent” to the year 2025 established by Beijing. The impulse comes at a time when US President Donald Trump intensified the Beijing Trade War, threatening a total dissociation between the world's two largest economies, at a time when China already faces a prolonged real estate crisis. The data released by the National Statistics Office (GNE) exceeded the consensual estimate of 5.2 percent of economists responded by the Bloomberg news agency. Industrial production expanded 7.7 percent in March, compared to the same period of the previous year, in faster growth since June 2021. Retail sales have increased by 5.9 percent, the best pace since December 2023. "The most pleasant surprise is retail sales, which shows that consumption subsidies are working," said Michelle Lam, economist at French Bank Society Generale SA to China, quoted by the agency. "Industrial production was a surprise, but understandable after the strong export data. But this is now part of the past," he told Bloomberg. Despite the positive data, the GNE recommended caution, stressing the need to give greater support to the economy. "We must be aware that the external environment is becoming more complex and severe. The impulse of internal demand for growth is insufficient and the basis for economic recovery and sustained growth is yet to consolidate," the office said in a statement. “We have to implement more pro-active and effective macroeconomic policies,” he said. Investment in fixed assets increased by 4.2 percent in the first three months of 2025, while the real estate investment registered a 9.9 percent contraction, extending the crisis that reached the sector in 2022. The urban unemployment rate was 5.2 percent in March, down 5.4 percent in the previous month. Bonança and Storm China may have difficulty reaching its official growth objective this year without further stimuli. In recent weeks, several international banks, including the UBS Group AG, Goldman Sachs Group Inc. and Citigroup Inc., have lowered their growth forecasts from China to about 4 percent or less, the result of the aggravating commercial tensions with Washington. Some economists expect China's Popular Bank to reduce interest rates or the amount of money banks should keep in reserve this month, while others provide for several Yuan billion in loans and additional tax expenses to fill the void left by falling exports. China has to rapidly increase domestic consumption and investment to counteract the impact of tariffs. The weakness of the labor market continues to prevent consumers from spending more, even before US fees reach export -related jobs. The impact of the trade war will probably speak out of economic activity from April, after an increase of 12.4 percent of exports in March, as companies rushed to complete orders. The possibility of an agreement between the US and China on commercial dispute seems reduced in the near future, as Beijing chose to retaliate the successive rounds of Tarump -imposed tariffs. China's scholarship rates largely kept their losses after the disclosure of the data, with Hang Seng China Enterprisses, which brings together the main Chinese Hong Kong companies, losing 2.4 percent, and the CSI 300, which replicates the performance of the 300 main actions traded in the Shanghai and Shenzhen bags, to fall 0.8 percent.

item.title: Japan | Regulator accuses Google of violating anti -monopoly laws
item.description: Japanese regulatory authorities accused US technology to violate anti-monopoly laws, referring to similar actions in the United States and Europe. Google Japan stated in a statement that it considered action “unfortunate” and the company said it has invested significantly in the country to promote innovation as a technological leader. The “order of cessation and withdrawal” of Japan's Fair Trade Commission says Google has to stop the Google search engine preinstallation on Android smartphones, which, according to the commission, actually excludes the competition. It is not known if Google, a subsidiary of Alphabet Inc., based in Silicone Valley, USA, will take legal action to combat the order. In the US, a judge decided last year that Google's “omnipresent” search engine illegally explored his dominance to master the competition. Google has denied the allegations, arguing that it is immensely popular because people like what it offers. Japanese regulators began research on Google in 2023 and say they have consulted foreign authorities who dealt with similar cases. European regulators also criticized what they consider to be Google's monopolistic domain. Tuesday's decision marks the first time that Japan's Fair Trade Commission takes action against a large world technological company.

item.title: Timor-Leste | Xanana and branches accused of destroying judicial system
item.description: Independent Timor-Leste Revolutionary Front Secretary-General Mari Alkatiri, accused President Jose Ramos-Horta yesterday, and Prime Minister Xanana Gusmão of destroying the country's judicial system "I just say that this is an extremely serious situation. Judicial independence is dying, due to the oligarchic dictatorship of two people: the president and the Timorese Prime Minister," said the former head of government Mari Alkatiri, at a press conference held at his office in Dili. Mari Alkatiri said this is a "dictatorship with a cape of democracy, oriented and controlled." "It is just these two people who know everything and do everything, exercising absolute power, total, taking advantage of the fragility of the judicial system. That's it. I know these two people very well. It is they who do not know me," said the leader of the opposition Timorese. Mari Alkatiri stressed that those “two figures” are using political power through the National Parliament to make changes and pass laws that undermine the judicial system, giving as an example the changes to the Anti -Corruption Commission Law (CAC) and the law of the judicial organization. Regarding changes in CAC Law, Mari Alkatiri said that the choice of the manager of that institution was made by a simple majority, when previously was by qualified majority. "This change to the law also demonstrates that, if the CAC commissioner does not work according to the will or guidance of the government, he may fire him at any time," he lamented. According to Alkatiri, the previous version of the law required consensus in the National Parliament for the commissioner's election, with a five -year term. "Therefore, I consider that this act of government is against the rights of citizens and against the principles of the rule of democratic law," he explained. Balance dishes With regard to changes to the law of the Judicial Organization, which began to be debated yesterday in the Timorese Parliament, Mari Alkatiri said they are preparing to allow judges with 20 years of experience to be appointed to the presidency of the Court of Appeal. This means that any judge chosen by the government can be appointed president of the Court of Appeal, said Mari Alkatiri. For Mari Alkatiri, that type of action is extremely dangerous because it can lead to the death of the rule of democratic law in Timor-Leste and undermine the country's credibility in the world. In 2023, after taking office as Prime Minister, Xanana Gusmão created a office for reform of the justice sector, led by Lúcia Lobato, former Minister of Justice, alleging weaknesses, scarcity of human resources and lack of response from the system. In an intervention issued in October of that year, the Timorese Prime Minister accused the Timor-Leste justice sector of "inspiring confidence" with society and implying that corruption only happens in "a particular segment."

item.title: Real Estate | New houses prices fall for the 22nd consecutive month
item.description: The prices of new houses in China fell for the 22nd consecutive month in March, despite the government's measures to wage the prolonged sector crisis. Prices in 70 selected cities fell 0.11 percent, compared to the previous month, according to data released yesterday by the Asian National Statistics Office (GNE). The fall in February was the same percentage value. Among the localities mentioned, 41 registered descents in the prices of new houses compared to 45 in February. Among these, 24 - including some important such as Shanghai or Shenzhen - registered increases, more than the previous month (18). GNE data also revealed a 0.2 percent drop in the price of secondhand houses in March, a more moderate pace than the one recorded in the previous month (0.3 percent). In the case of this type of real estate, 56 of the 70 cities registered descents, four remained at the same level as in December and ten registered climbs. In recent months, Chinese authorities have continued to announce measures to wrap the real estate market, an issue that worries Beijing due to their implications for social stability, as housing is one of the main investment vehicles of Chinese families. One of the main causes of the recent softening of the Chinese economy is precisely the crisis of the real estate sector, whose weight in national GDP - adding the indirect factors - was estimated at about 30 percent, according to some analysts.

item.title: Malaysia alongside China in the field of trade
item.description: Malaysia “is next to China” in the field of commerce, Malaysian Prime Minister Anwar Ibrahim said yesterday at the beginning of a visit by Chinese President Xi Jinping to Southeast Asian country. "We are next to the Chinese government, for the well-being of our people and our national economic interests, as well as for the general development and stability of our country," Anwar told Chinese state television CGTN. Xi, who is visiting a week to three Southeast Asian countries, was received by a 21-shot salary upon arriving at the National Palace for an audience with the king of Malaysia, sultan Ibrahim Iskandar, accompanied by Prime Minister Anwar. The visit occurs at a time when Xi tries to introduce his country as a defender of free trade and a source of stability to countries in the region, which are the main targets of the tariff war launched by US leader Donald Trump. Beijing and Kuala Lumpur are expected to sign agreements designed to increase Malaysian exports, including palm and durião oil, increase the influx of tourists and Chinese students to Southeast Asia and Chinese technology sharing in sectors such as renewable energy. On the other hand, analysts have warned that China expects Malaysia and its Southeast Asian neighbors to support it as the main power of the region - an alignment that could cause a reaction from Washington. ASEAN Extension In Malaysia, Xi should discuss a free trade agreement between China and the 10 members of the Southeast Asian Nations Association (Asean), as Malaysia chairs the association this year. Quoted by the Chinese press, Asean's secretary-general Kao Kim Hourn said the deal will eliminate many of the customs between China and the block members. "We will reduce the rates to zero in many cases and then expand them to all areas," he said in an interview with CGTN. Malaysia is the headquarters of several projects of the track and route initiative, including a Chinese rail project worth $ 11.2 billion. China is also the largest commercial partner and one of Malaysia's main direct foreign investment sources. Xi has already visited Vietname and leaves to Cambodia.

item.title: Hong Kong | Sending orders to the United States suspended
item.description:
Hong Kong's post office yesterday announced the suspension of ordering orders to the United States in response to the imposition, "abusive", tariffs by US authorities. Postcards with documents only, without goods, will not be affected
"The Hongkong Post will not definitely charge any customs rates on behalf of the US and will suspend the acceptance of postal shipments containing goods destined to the US," says a post office. For orders via maritime and terrestrial, the decision has immediate effect “due to longer shipping”, and for the air mail, comes into force on April 27, the note indicates. In the case of “surface mail with goods that have not yet been issued to the US,” the Hongkong Post will organize the return and reimbursement of sizes from April 22. The United States “are not being reasonable, they are intimidating and imposing customs rights abusively,” says the statement. Donald Trump signed an executive order last week that ends the exemptions of customs rights on small orders from China, such as those sent by the giants of E -commerce Shein and Temu. China and the United States have entered the scale for fares: Washington imposed over-thexes of 145 percent on Chinese products entering American territory, and those that existed before Donald Trump's return to the White House. Beijing retaliated with a rate that now reaches the 125 percent. A presidential decree issued by Donald Trump in 2020 eliminated the preferential treatment granted to Hong Kong. The ancient British colony is therefore equally affected by the 145 percent surcharge imposed on China. "For the sending of articles to the US, Hong Kong audiences must be prepared to pay exorbitant and irrational rates due to the Unreasible and Aggressive acts of the US. The other postcards containing only documents, without commodities, will not be affected," concluded the Hongkong Post. Letter response The Chinese Communist Party's main official for Hong Kong and Macao affairs and the leaders of the governments of both regions accused the United States of imposing tariffs to sabotage China. "The US has targeted our tariffs, they target our own survival," said Xia Baolong, director of the Hong Kong and Macau affairs, under the protection of the State Council. "Although Hong Kong is the largest source of US commercial surplus, the United States still imposed high tariffs. This is extremely arrogant and blatant," said Xia. The US continued the leader, "cannot tolerate Hong Kong's prosperity and stability and are the biggest sinister manipulator that undermines human rights, freedom, rule of law, prosperity and stability in Hong Kong." Chinese administrative government leader John Lee Ka-Chiu accused the United States of, in a "wicked logic," imposing tariffs to protect his "unhealthy hegemony." "The United States oppose free trade, interrupt global trade and supply chains (…), severely damaging the multilateral trade system and the process of globalization," said John Lee. Also the leader of the Macao Executive criticized, on the same day, the United States for the "abusive imposition of customs taxes on all its business partners," including China, "under various pretexts." During the inauguration of an exhibition due to National Security Education Day, Sam Hou Fai said Washington "severely devastated the multilateral trade system (...) and impaired the stability of the world economic order." Lusa asked Macao's post office if the company will follow the same steps from its Hong Kong counterpart, but the postal department did not respond in a timely manner.

item.title: Singapore | Dissolved Parliament paves the way to general elections
item.description: The Parliament of Singapore has been dissolved, paving the way for general elections in which the Popular Action Party (PAP), which has long ruled the country, will try to strengthen its dominion, under the command of Prime Minister Lawrence Wong. The Electoral Department set May 3 as a date for the elections. The victory has been practically guaranteed to PAP, which leads Singapore since its independence in 1965. Wong, who took office as Singapore's fourth leader in May last year, wants to win a more robust victory after the PAP suffered a setback in the 2020 elections due to the growing discontent of voters with the government. Wong succeeded Lee Hsien Loong, who resigned after two decades in charge of the country. Lee's departure marked the end of a family dynasty began by his father, Lee Kuan Yew, the first Singapore leader who turned the island into one of the richest nations in the world during his 31st years. In the 2020 elections, held during the Covid-19 pandemic, PAP maintained the absolute majority, with 83 of the 93 parliamentary seats, but lost places for the opposition, which increased parliamentary representation from six to 10, the largest ever registered.

item.title: Tariffs | UBS points to economic growth of 3.4%
item.description: The UBS AG added yesterday to a series of low-chinese economy growth reviews the most pessimistic forecast among major banks, predicting that only 3.4 percent will expand this year, reflecting the impact of US tariffs. The Swiss bank, which previously foresaw a 4 percent growth in 2025, maintained its estimate for next year in 3 percent. Both forecasts are the lowest of all projections compiled by Bloomberg agency. "Tariff shock puts unprecedented challenges to exports to China and will trigger a major adjustment to the home economy," wrote UBS economists, including Tao Wang, in a note published yesterday. Goldman Sachs Group and Citigroup are among the global banks that have reduced their prospects for China in recent days, with most economists doubting that Beijing can achieve the official growth objective of about 5 percent this year. If the current increases in customs rates are maintained, it is likely to drag China's Gross Domestic Product growth at more than 2 percent, despite the expected additional stimuli of Beijing, according to the UBS. Economists admitted that their opinion has “high margins of error” due to the “extremely large uncertainty” surrounding the ongoing trade war. Exports to the US should fall two thirds in the next quarters and the total shipments abroad may fall 10% in dollars this year, they added. "We think that some of China's other business partners will also be able to increase rates on Chinese products in the coming months, but probably only about specific products and not in magnitudes similar to US tariffs," they said.

item.title: Xi Jinping honors Ho Chi Minh with a visit to his mausoleum
item.description: Chinese President Xi Jinping yesterday honored the Vietname Independence Hero, Ho Chi Minh, with a visit to his mausoleum in Hanoi, as part of a visit to the country integrated in a journey through Southeast Asia. At the head of a high-level Chinese delegation with Vietnam Communist Party Secretary-General to Lam, Vietname's main leader Xi Jinping led offerings to the Ho Chi Minh Mausoleum (1890-1969) in the Vietnamese capital. Ho Chi Minh, Vietname's most important revolutionary leader, was the first president of the Vietname Democratic Republic (Vietname do Norte) from 1951 to his death and is still revered today by most Vietnamese. Despite the opposition of the leader to the creation of temples and statues in his name, six years after his death, following the North Communist victory over the Pro-American South in the Vietnam War, the mausoleum where his remains rest was built in Hanoi and became one of the capital's main attractions. During the XI visit to the Southeast Asia country, Vietnam and China signed 45 cooperation agreements in areas such as Artificial Intelligence (AI), the trade in agricultural products and customs cooperation. Needle XI's visit to the neighboring country, with which Beijing also maintains tensions, especially related to territorial disputes, is loaded with symbolism and appears at a time when both parties have considered options compared to the commercial war of US President Donald Trump. Beijing faces rates of 145 percent, which he responded at 125 percent rates, while Vietnam is negotiating reductions in 46 percent rates announced and then temporarily suspended by Washington. Continuing his journey through Southeast Asia, who considers a “diplomatic priority” given the profound trade relations between the two actors-China is the main commercial partner of the Southeast Asian Nations Association (Asean)-Xi moved to Malaysia yesterday, the second stop of a trip that will end in Cambodia.

item.title: Álvaro Barbosa, vice-rector of the University of São José: “Student visa is very limiting”
item.description:
The University of São José continues the negotiation saga with the Chinese authorities to recruit students from the interior of China. Vice-rector Álvaro Barbosa expects, soon, the increase in master's students from 30 to 200. Regarding the internationalization of higher education, the official advocates changes in student visas to facilitate recruitment
Does the recruitment of students from the interior of China remain a matter pending to the University of Saint Joseph? It is a process that is underway. We have had huge support from the Macao government in negotiations to obtain the quota for our university, and they have been tireless in the effort to try to resolve the issues raised by the central government. Many of the questions are legitimate and concern concerns that arise. We were granted a temporary quota of 30 students for masters ago over a probative period, which served to evaluate how we, as Western University, would host students from China. From China, there is this concern with the host of students in Macau. I think we have made a huge effort and the students who are there, included in this contingent, are quite satisfied. Is this quota for masters just? Yes. For a degree we do not have authorization yet. In this way, we are currently at the time we try to overcome this probative period in order to obtain a quota of about 200 students for masters. We are in the final phase of the evaluation process and everything has been doing well. We will have the possibility that, next academic year, expand this quota. That would be great, because for our university, to have a greater impact of our mission in Macao, it is essential to have access to students from mainland China. We cannot be a university in an integrated region in a country like China, and not contact with students from China. Is it more difficult for USJ to compete with other universities, such as those of Hong Kong, by foreign students, outside China? The issue of recruitment of international students has become a priority for Macao universities. In the last two or three years, it has become evident that this internationalization is very important. What difficulty is there? There is the issue related to student visas, as these visas currently do not allow students to do any kind of work, denying them that minimum local subsistence mechanism to be able to meet expenses. Nor is it contemplated the possibility of, when the student concludes his formation, to be in the territory and find work. What all countries and regions that are competitive in higher education do, such as Singapore, Hong Kong or Australia, is to have incentive policies. Allow students to work part -time, for example. In Hong Kong when a degree ends, the student can stay in the territory up to a maximum of two years to find a job. This kind of measures do not yet exist in Macau, but I think the government is pondering this possibility. From the moment the decision was made that the internationalization of higher education was important, this must be accompanied with the corresponding measures. The current student visa is extremely limiting and does not encourage the coming to Macao to study, only allows coming. This issue was not as present as it is now, but now there is a strategic policy of internationalization. É também uma questão de sobrevivência para as universidades locais. Sim. Talvez não haja maior exemplo de catalisador da diversificação da economia de Macau do que o ensino superior. Temos dez instituições, 60 mil alunos em cerca de 700 mil habitantes. É esse o potencial da internacionalização, o de fomentar a diversificação.
And also the research that comes out of higher education. The investigation, the dynamics of the work that is done. There are a number of vectors that higher education brings to a region or country, this happened to Portugal, for example, with the policy of doctoral scholarships for students from abroad, which completely changed the dynamics of higher education. Cape Verde developed thanks to the impact of higher education. Then we need to make the system more flexible in Macau. I don't know if it's a matter of having a holistic view of strategy. There may be an idea, but then it does not intervene in all the necessary dimensions to achieve a certain goal. But I am very optimistic. I believe this new student policy is a key step to be taken in Macau. The internationalization strategy followed by all these countries and regions I spoke, and were successful in capturing international students, was always the same. No need to invent much. First, one should increase the capacity and notoriety of universities, and then a policy of scholarships, which will enhance a student flow, creating a reference for the territory, so that studying there becomes a habit. After this flow of students for a few years, an image is already created and some scholarships can be removed, which students will continue to choose a particular territory to study in it. Australia has a huge higher education industry, for example, and I think that in Macau we just have to follow the same strategies. We do, at USJ, that a little. How, in concrete terms? We offer many scholarships, and in this sense the Diocese of Macao has helped us build this flow of international students that allow us to create this dynamic that we hope will be sustainable by itself in the future. I think the government is also doing this. There have always been scholarships in Macau, attributed mainly by the Macau Foundation, but this measure will be strengthened. Solving the student's visa issue, creating a scholarship incentive system for five to ten years, Macau will have a bright future as an international higher education destination. But we need to invest, continue, and it takes a few years. USJ created the “Macau Hub” platform, in partnership with the Macau Scientific and Cultural Center (CCCM) in 2023. At what stage is this project? This project has to do with our interest in developing a relationship dynamic of Lusophone countries centered in Lisbon in the area of ​​entrepreneurship, first. This cabinet we have at CCCM is not intended to offer training in Portugal, but we want to do something else. As we are positioned in the Great Bay and with Hengqin, where it is intended to activate a business ecosystem, we want to take advantage of the fact that we have relations with the Lusophone world to activate the access of the startups of Portugal, Brazil and Angola, above all, to the great bay and hengqin. We are trying to create a kind of incubator of transnational companies, in which we support the development of Lusophone businesses that want to settle in the large bay and also the reverse system. Strategically, for a university, it is absolutely fundamental to have a dynamic in the area of ​​entrepreneurship. Currently, more than half of our students do not want to go to the corporate world, but create their own businesses. Just as universities have to have employability solutions, they also have to have them for entrepreneurs, who are increasingly. So a university has to have a business incubator. My vision of the future for higher education goes around: a university, besides having a library and canteen, will also have its own business incubator. I would say that most students of management or economy courses dream of having their own business, especially in China. China is perhaps one of the most entrepreneurial countries in the world. item.title: Adelina Moura, teacher and trainer: “The mobile phone is like a Swiss knife”
item.description:
Graduated in the area of ​​educational technologies, Adelina Moura will conduct lectures to parents, students and teachers about the use of digital technologies in classrooms, within the “Letters & Company” festival of the Portuguese Institute of the East. The teacher understands that prohibiting mobile phone in schools is not a solution
What are the challenges felt by teachers with the introduction of technologies in the classroom? Can the mobile phone actually be a complement to learning? Yes. I've been saying this since 2005. The mobile phone can be an excellent learning tool, a means to motivate students and to enrich their learning. We have a kind of Swiss knife here, a very powerful equipment in the hands of the students and there is a school failure, because they do not work and help students enhance this equipment they have. What happens is that students learn in the worst way, in a destructed way, by attempt-rrove. There is a gap, as students are not alerted to the positive potential for mobile phone use. They face their mobile phones as a free time use, spending time on social networks and scrolling, and time consumes. It is essential that teachers are users, in their practices, mobile phones, and for the preparation of classes and other projects, to know how to prepare students. I consider that the school has lost several stages of students' preparation and awareness to use these equipment that lead to classes and with which schools have not spent any money. With the prohibition of bringing the mobile phone to the classroom we did not advance anything in this regard. During the pandemic period, for example, the use of technologies, with distance learning, was quite enhanced. But during the pandemic we also burned some steps regarding the use of digital by teachers, because before the pandemic many teachers did not believe or used. They thought it was a fashion and they saw no use in the use of mobile phones and other technologies. With the pandemic the use of these equipment proved that without them the situation of education would have been much worse. In these pandemic years, teachers have become more aware of the technologies that already exist and are available to anyone. With internet access on mobile phone, something that has existed since 2007 with the launch of the first iPhone, the e-learning system is enhanced and then we move to “Mobile Learning”, where you can learn anywhere and anytime with mobile devices. It is this reality that we see a little away from school. And after the pandemic, how has it been? I think we will take a few more steps towards digital literacy. With Artificial Intelligence (IA), it seems that we are as in the phase I created my first website in 1999 or email in 1995. We are at the beginning. But it is 30 years of technology where there have been many changes, and technology in fact goes on and if we immediately do not realize what we have available, we and students, we help create a moat that has happened in the past compared to digital. So these former students came to society and did not bring this sensitivity to digital, to educate their children. We teachers, when we do digital training, are doing good to society because we are also preparing these young people for the future, because they will be parents and should be aware of educating their children. At school we do not only prepare for the job market, but for personal and family life. Hence teacher education is essential. The invitation I received from IPOR seems to me an excellent holistic view of everything, because the school includes several actors, connecting with society. How should AI be introduced into the classroom? We currently watch changes in search engines, in fact. We have search engines created from root to Age Age, for example. The best way to introduce AI into the classroom is to ask students and how they use it, and already resort to this tool. At the beginning of the academic year I always ask students to answer a questionnaire about their digital routines, and then I know more or less their practices. In 2023, when the chatgPT came out, I introduced AI in my classes, and realized that students were using this tool to deceive the teachers. Students have to realize that when using AI, they are falling into a certain trap because they are not learning. It is the law of the lowest effort, equal to the phase in which the internet emerged, when students selected, copied and sent to the teacher. We now have the problem that the answers are in Brazilian Portuguese, for example, and see as soon as I was used. We have, therefore, to dismantle this action in the heads and face them. That is, it seems to have gained some conscience. It will give these lectures in a different educational context in Asia, where the use of mobile phone can be earlier. How will you deal with these differences, or do you understand that the problems of using technology in the classroom are transversal? It is a transverse question. Do we have to wonder if the use of a particular equipment and tool will make us wiser? It seems to me not, because we may have the equipment, but the use we make it varies a lot. I tell my students that they should be ashamed, because they have much easier access to content than in my time, when we truly had to do research and read in physical format. I tell them that with this technology they should all have a grade 20, and that they are wasting resources, being dishonest intellectually, because they sign works that are not theirs and do not read, even, they deliver. One of the works we have with students is to teach them how to make bibliographic references, refer to the sources. But I am an optimistic by nature, and I hope that in a decade, secondary education students who are fathers and mothers will be able to deal with these problems of social networks and increase fraud with their children. It is this “parents school” that the school can help create. We are in a moment with no return of digital, and forbidding is the most comfortable situation, but it is not the best to face reality. We have to use the right words to alert. We have in this time of alerts and consciences, encouraging the critical spirit of our students, which is little today.
